text:
As other reviewers have mentioned, the beer selection is great, but.... no Guinness on tap!?!  Isn't there a rule about this, somewhere?  That to be considered a bar with a good beer selection you have to have the real King-of-Beers on tap?  Out of a bottle does not do my Guinny any justice.  

The food is bar food but for a vegetarian, it is a terrible selection.  The salads are not good.  HUGE but not tasty.  My husband liked the wings just fine.  

Too many other places with beer selection and good food for this to my go-to bar.  Or to be a go-again bar.

Awesome place to watch sports - they've got a ton of flat screens with multiple sports channels going - and one of the best beer selections around. I'm a huge craft beer fan and this place definitely hits the spot. Pub style food is done well, too ;)

Duckworth's is the best place in Charlotte for craft beer.  Hands Down.

This is a place I go anytime I am in the area to try some new beers or enjoy one of my favorites.  The taps constantly rotate and they always have a good selection of seasonals/rarities (Think Stone Enjoy By)

Beer flights are relatively inexpensive and give you a chance to try a bit of everything on the 60+ tap menu.

There is something for everyone, from your most basic of beers to some of the rarest beers in the country.  They have a number of local brews as well as beers from around the world.  The bartenders are well versed in the craft beer scene and will answer any question you throw at them or give you a suggestion on what to try

The beer by itself can be a bit on the expensive side but remember you are paying for quality, not quantity.

The food Menu consists of awesome bar fare and snacks.  I can't get over how good their Philly Cheesesteaks are.  The Smokehouse Philly was one of the better sandwiches I've had at a "chain" restaurant.  The Buffalo Chicken Nachos are also very unique and delicious. I was somewhat surprised by the high price of the food bill (Nachos were 14.99, sandwich 13.99).

For Sports, Duckworth's has all the Major sports packages, which is a plus for an out of towner like myself.

If I had 1 complaint it's that the servers aren't too attentive to your needs.  I've asked to have a game put on only to have to ask multiple times before it was changed.  Same for refills, napkins, ect.  Also parking is a bit scarce in the area but not too bad with a strip mall next to it.

Overall this is a great place to enjoy a beer and snack.  I look forward to coming back every time.

Fantastic Service. Have to be careful what you order. I ordered the famous supreme steak Philly and it was excellent. My wife ordered their chicken breast dinner and said it was not that great. Said the chicken tasted like it was frozen and just warmed up. Although she didn't complain. Just be careful what you order. Otherwise service is always good and prompt. I would recommend it and especially the steak hoogies and supreme is the best thing on menu.
Fantastic service, awesome beer selection draft and bottle, and great staff. Family friendly with a good tv selection.  Lesley was a great waitress.

Very wide selection of beer. Don't get too comfortable with a beer, one month it's there and the next month it may be gone. Food is pretty good too. A little loud and somewhat crowded at night but lunch time is usually not as busy.

The wings and sweet potato fries were delicious! Each of us had different style wings and they were all unique and wonderful! The regular fries and tater tots were much better than expected. It was loud because of several football games happening on a Saturday night but that's what you get at a place like this. 

The service was just okay, our appetizer came out with our food and our waitress mixed up our beer order but she was very nice. Again if you're going for good wings or what I deem as "sports" food my guess is it would be hard to beat!
Food was good. Many choices of beer. Quick service. Will be back . Plenty tv's to watch games . Overall all experience was good. Glad I stopped .

I love coming to this place. It seems Every time i come my food is different.  Cooks are not on the same page. I always sit near the kitchen hoping my homestyle fries are hot but they never are..i usually come about 2xa week but I have writte. So many comments and nothing change. I'm going to try another one. I live in Ballantyne but I will drive anywhere for good food.

Just paid almost 9.00 for a really bad cheesesteak.  Meat is not good quality and the bread was not even close to the kind used for Philly's.  Save your money and go to Jersey Mike's.  They at least have decent Philly's.
Never had anything we didn't love. Don't leave without trying the sweet potato fries. Service is great!
This place is great, very nice and relaxing atmosphere and both the food and service was excellent!!!!
Avg food, mediocre service. Does have good beers.  For all the beers they have staff should be more knowledgeable.

I'm conflicted about this place. Lots of great beer on offer, but very little in the lager range. Food is okay, but not reliable in quality. Service is sort of hit and miss, can be good, can be indifferent. Take your chance, maybe you'll catch them on a good night.
Excellent beer selection on tap,and some of my favorite pizza in Charlotte.

Cory/"Beer Boy" is on point well done great specials tues/thurs. Food is always fresh
-Adam

I'm here based on Yelp. Great tap bar. Had a Terra give me her favorite 4 pale
Ales in the sampler. The Bells Oberon was best. Had the moomamoo wings and bold and spicy wings in a 10 wing special. Bothe were great! Wings were average size:( A serving of 10 met my needs.

Besides the beer sampler, I had a "Strawberry Wit" beer blend. It was fabulous.

Dessert was fair. I had pumpkin praline pie. Asked for alamode and Terra said the don't have ice cream:(. She got me some whipping cream. The pie was terrific, like a cheese cake. Did not need alamode. Glad I didn't order the choc cake. 

Terra served bar. She was terrific!

We checked out the new location last week.  The bar and tap line-up are unprecedented for anywhere in the Southend or Montford area.  And since it was the opening weekend, and very busy, I'll overlook the luke-warm temperature of the several different beers that I tried.

The cheesesteak sandwich I had was very good, but the lack of any type of side was disappointing for the price.  

There was also a band that night, but the set-up of the new location is not very conducive.  We could hardly even hear the band from where we were seated even though we were not that far away. We had a much nicer time when the bands played in the courtyard. 

Unfortunately in life, there are constant trade offs. I just need to find a way to combine the outdoor patio of Macs, the ice-cold draft pours at Icehouse, and the 60 tap draft selection of Duckworths. Oh, and lets add a Macs pulled-pork Philly sandwich to that list.

Stopped at Duckworth's recently to celebrate our anniversary by chance; our first choice has a long wait and I'd been wanting to try Duckworth's for some time.  I'd heard that the beer selection was quite good and was not disappointed in that regard.  They featured a nice sampling of local, regional and national craft beers both on draft and in bottle.  And best of all it was $3 dollar Tuesday.  The menu is extensive and the four of us ordered different items, ranging from a sandwich to a salad to an entree.  The portion sizes were large and represented a good value for the money.  Good was tasty and nicely prepared and all at the table enjoyed the meal.  I'll return again, although it is a bit of a drive for us so it won't be on a regular basis.  It would make for a great neighborhood hangout.

Came for drinks and a bite to catch up with a friend. Great beer selection. Very pleasant wait staff with good knowledge of beer list. Reminds me somewhat of Capital Ale House in Richmond, VA. I'll be back.

Great Place to Grab a Beer and Eat Incredible Food 

I'm becoming a regular at Duckworths because every time I go, I receive excellent service, an almost unrivalled beer selection, and astounding food at a very fair price. 

Ambiance is low key, lots of TV to catch the game and very friendly staff. Never had to wait more than 15 minutes for food, and if it does take too long, managers are quick to make it right. 

In my opinion, one of the best places to eat in Charlotte!
Great service, great food, and great atmosphere.  Wide variety so everyone should find something they like here.  Also has a nice patio if you want to enjoy the outside.

Great atmosphere-nice staff-great food! 
Love the steak and cheese w tator tots or flatbread so yummy :)

A friend became ill at Duckworth's and passed out. I paid the bill and went to go sit with a friend, and wait to go to the hospital. While... the EMT's were still working on her, the manager felt it was more important to accuse us of not paying twenty dollar bar tab (that had already been paid) than to ask if she was ok. He then accused her of going to the bathroom and doing illegal drugs, and wanted to know what drugs she was on.

He later banned her from the restaurant  because, and I quote: "I don't want anyone in here that may be on medication." Apparently he thinks he has the right to demand to know what medication you may be taking in order to overpay for food in his restaurant. 

Even after it was explained that she most likely had a reaction to a new medication that she was prescribed he continued to state that he didn't want anyone on medication in his restaurant and that he had the right to know what medications anyone eating there was taking. 

I have never witnessed a manager in a restaurant act the way he did, and will never give this place a dime of my money again.  If you believe in privacy and being treated with respect you won't either.

Wonderful service, great beer,fantastic meal, great price.  Well worth the trip and will be back MANY more Times....!!

I got the pizza,ribs, wings...all great...some of the best in the Queen City

Horrible service by a server who I can see talking on his cell phone in the kitchen.  After waiting 15 minutes for a beer, I went up to the bar to get one.  Bartenders walked past number of times and just continued to clean behind the bar.  You can tell when someone has taken notice of you, but for some reason they were more set on cleaning.  After about 25 minutes asked the server for the beer again and finally received it.  

Saw the manager take notice of all the finished dishes on our table and never did anything about it.  After a half hour, decided to clear the dishes myself and place on table next to us.  

Total fail on part of the owners and management.  Sorry you had to work on the Super Bowl, but it's the business you choose to work in.  Only plus side was when Kendra took over as our server and was attentive to us for the rest of the evening.

I had the Chicken Quesadillas here last week and they were awesome!  Chris was our waiter and he did a great job.  

Five Stars all the way!  :)
Alex was our server and was on pointe and spot on fantastic. The food was tasty and fresh. Fish tacos were amazing and savory good. I will def be back!

I have been to a lot of places that have some good beer on tap.  I have been to some places that have a good beer special every now and then.  I have never been to such a place that offers 60 HIGH QUALITY craft beers for $2.50 twice a week ( and great $2.50 specials everyday).  Most places dare to even offer Newcastle or Bass for $2.50 and you will not see either one of those beers on tap at Duckworth's.  I'm talkin Founders, Duck Rabbit, Dogfish, PISGAH, and the list goes on and on for $2.50!!  The new location reminds me of Hickory Tavern due to the amount of HDTV's all aorund and decor without the overpriced food.  This place is EXACTLY what South Charlotte (or America) needed.......an unbeievable beer bar with great food and great service.  Now anytime I pay more than $2.50 for ANY beer, much less the quality offered at dworths, I feel ripped off.

$3 craft beer drafts on Thursdays = a beer snob's dream

I live in Jersey City, so to get $3 drafts anywhere is a rarity and a treat. Perhaps I should visit my family in Charlotte more often. Bartenders were friendly and there were TVs everywhere for lots of sports-watching. Crowd seemed a little fratty though.

I got to Duckworths around 6pm on a Wed. it was packed! We had to sit outside because the bar was full. I usually come for the cheesesteaks which are ok (it's to best I can find around me. I'd say a 6 out of 10). When we told are waiter that we weren't ordering food he flaked on us. Sitting outside has its downsides but taking 15 minutes for another beer is a little much. They do however have a hefty choice of beers that I will be back to try... from the bar... inside.

2013 Battle of the Casks is an awesome event. Many of the local breweries are represented with their best casks of beer. We tasted and laughed and "tasted" some more in the parking lot, then they moved all the kegs inside for us to continue the party! You stay classy, Duckworth's Grill & Taphouse.

First time visiting last night.  I had the philly cheese steak and it was awesome.  I tried as many of the beers on tap that I could but didn't get too far down the line up since Duckworth's has hundreds of beers on tap.  Great atmosphere, good food and service.  I'll be back

I like any place that offers a wide variety of beer and not just the same ones over and over. The fact that they have so many different beers on tap and in the bottle means I can always find exactly what im in the mood for. What makes this place amazing though is the food, I have been here several times and I am yet to have anything that is less than amazing.

To highlight from my last experience. Please read below

"It seems like I am here more than I am at my house. Katie and Larry do an awesome job every time I am here. Tonight... Not so much. Didn't know this bartender but apparently the NFL fantasy football draft was more important than the hungry bar guests sitting directly in front of them. One of which included the manager on a laptop. When I asked to order something I was not heard and the bartender left for a smoke break. Hmmm not a good way to end. Went to spend my money somewhere else. I'll wait for Katie and Larry to be here."

The wicked witch is dead.... Kidding... kind of. BUT on the good stuff. Duckworths Management more than made up for the blunder experience. These are great people that want to make sure you are taken care of. As soon as I walked in the door after my review a Kurtis (bar manager) immediately apologized and treated me to a gift card, made sure everything was top notch and has done so every time I have seen him since. Great rebound Duckworths. I shall continue my patronage until the beer ceases to flow. Thanks.
Duckworth's is a great atmosphere filled with good food and great staff. I highly recommend the Cobb Salad with Chicken. It's amazing!

One of Charlotte's better sports bar type chains.  They have great beer selection with about 40 on tap as well another 40 or so in the bottle.

Their prices might be a few dollars higher than the bigger chain sports bars, but they have a diverse menu:  pizzas, salads, wraps, sandwiches, and tex- mex selections.

An excellent place to view a game.  They have tons of TVs so they can put 8-12 games on at once. I enjoyed being there for an NFL Sunday afternoon.  The crowd was 60%Panther fans with a good number of NFC East fans as well (Cowboys, Giants, Redskins).  It was good crowd with people interested in the games but no one being obnoxious or rude.

I believe a lot of families enjoy coming here mid week as it's fairly kid friendly. I think they have some family specials mid week.
Think sports bar food and variety but delicious - every time! Philly cheesesteak, nachos, BBQ, salad, chicken quesadilla are a few of my favorites.

Great beer selection, excellent staff. Terrific location to watch the game.

Nachos, Philly Cheesesteaks, and Wings are their top dogs.

Lousy service. Four of us sat down at a bar area table. I ordered the draft special, they were out, it was 3:00 pm. Ordered the bottle special, they were out. No offer was made in lieu of deficiency.  Asked for a menu, "just one?" was the response.  Ordered several  food items to split, server brought 3 plates and no silverware.  Asked for silverware, she basically ignored us while conversing with what appeared to be a friend at the bar. Went to the bar to get silverware and additional plate. Terrible, terrible, terrible.
First time there. Food was excellent and the service was first class. Make sure you ask for Feye.She gave first class service.. I will go back again.

Good food, Great Drink Prices and a good atmosphere!  Service is pretty good too.  

They have a great draft beer selection and they have a beer/brewery of the month for only $2.50.

I will definitely be back!

I went to Duckworth's for a quick meal one night and it was great! This was my first time there, and our server was super nice and friendly. We didn't have to wait long at all to get our food. I had the Carolina BBQ sandwich, and it was delicious! It was also reasonably priced. I really don't have any complaints and will definitely go back.

Not much to analyze....this is more Sysco slop straight off the truck.  Minimal prep required with minimal generic taste to match.  Salads drowned in dressing with the dressing full of enough MSG to swell your ankles up for a week.

Dazzling array of beers tempered by the knowledge that half of them aren't very good.  Must echo the review on this page noting that checking IDs of people obviously well beyond age 21 insults the intelligence of all concerned and tends to sour the relationship with the bartender from the word go.  Smug buttons with 'We ID everybody' don't compensate for legal overkill, intellectual laziness and a lack of common sense.

Too many of today's parents of young children believe that any place serving food is fair game for the little darlings even if the establishment in question is primarily a bar.  One mother, who apparently was an employee but off-duty, brought the little heathen 'Crawford' (groan) over to sit him on the bartop where he grabbed straws and napkins out of the caddy and hurled them in random directions.  Of course, mom thought this was adorable - adults trying to enjoy an adult beverage somewhat less so.

I don't smoke but perhaps a rethink of smoking bans is warranted if it prevents every establishment from becoming a branch of Chuck E. Cheese.

it's a shame that local places have fallen prey to the same assembly line mentality as their corporate competition.  Duckworth's tastes like Chili's tastes like Applebee's tastes like Friday's.   Given that all are buying the same raw materials from the same vendor this shouldn't be a surprise but it is nevertheless discouraging trying to find a place where they actually use recipes rather than reading directions on the side of a box.  The quest continues.

I tried Duckworth's with a group of friends last night celebrating someone's birthday. We arrived around 9:15 and the place was packed. Seeing all of the people there made me excited to try the food. Surely it would be good, I thought. Wrong!

First off, our waiter put my boyfriend's order in wrong. He ordered the barbecue sandwich but somehow our waiter thought he said the Carolina burger? We brought this to the attention of our waiter who called the manager over. The manager very kindly took it off of our ticket. He had ordered the garlic fries as his side and they were so covered in garlic they were inedible. It was like someone took a spoonful of minced garlic and plopped it on top.

I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap. Which, according to the description, was supposed to have chicken, buffalo sauce, ranch, shredded cheese, and field greens. When I got the wrap I couldn't even tell it was buffalo chicken. There was no cheese to be seen and, the grossest part was that the field greens were slimy and wet...like they were scraped from the bottom of a bag. There was no crunch whatsoever. Absolutely disgusting. The fries I got were not hot, nor were they fresh from what I could tell. We brought this to the attention of the waiter, who got his manager, and the manager took it off our check, too.


We are not ones to EVER send food back or complain (we've both worked in the food industry before), but the quality of Duckworth's food was just terrible. I don't think I'll give this place another try. There are too many restaurants in that area that are much better.

We came here on a Friday night around 6p before it really filled up. We were seated quickly and our drink orders were taken. This place has quite the selection of craft beers on tap, I was amazed at the variety of local beers on draft. We tried some wings and they were incredible good. The pizza was just good but it hit the spot. My buddy's kid ordered a kiddie dish of wings with the sweet bbq sauce and it was a little to spicy for the kid and I was extremely impressed at how one of the staff could tell by observing that something wasn't cool and he came over and asked. He had no problems bringing a new order of wings for the child. Throughout our meal the service was probably some of the best service I have experienced in a long time even for the place being completely packed. 

Be careful though trying to make your way to the restrooms it is a little confusing and it is easy to go into the wrong one if you aren't paying attention. That happened to me HA!
Best place in town to get a cheesesteak. Service, atmosphere and food are fantastic. Tons of TV's for the big game!  My favorite sub is the chicken philly with cheese whiz.
Solid food, solid service, great draft beer list. Something for everyone on the menu. Lots of TVs but they weren't distracting if you didn't want to watch.

This edition of Exciting about Eating takes us to the Park Road area of Charlotte and to Duckworth's Grill and Taphouse. This neighborhood grill sports a full menu including salads, pizza, steaks, and yes, Philly cheesesteak.

Dora here. Check out that super sweet patio. And we were impressed with the interior. Clean and fresh, not like some pubs that smell like the night before.

For my lunch, I chose the Steak Fajitas served over a bed of sautéed peppers and onions. I chose not to include the beans or rice and opted for a side salad. The fajitas were great. The steak was cooked to a perfect medium with a tender texture. The peppers and onions had just enough crunch, the way I like them, not like a lot of fajitas with overcooked and mushy veggies.

Dora here. Yeah, yeah, I know that people eat with their eyes first and this plate doesn't score points for presentation, but that sirloin was so tender I actually cut it with a butter knife. So maybe I need an update on my eyeglass prescription. lol.

Good thing service was quick and efficient because I drooled over this photo the whole time we waited. I could definitely sink my teeth into this goodie. Didn't tempt hubby, though. Does it do anything for you?

We rate this restaurant 4 forks out of 5 forks for a family friendly restaurant serving great food. ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog

We moved from the Queen City about 2 years ago, but ANYTIME, and I mean anytime my family returns to visit Charlotte, visiting Duckworth's is a must.
Everything they sell is delish.  Special note for their pizzas, salads, wings and Philly CheeseSteaks.  GARLIC FRIES are a must side.  Trust me try them.
The service is always sincere, and prompt. Food cooked to order, hot and quality.
Longtime server Chris is great!  Kelly also served our family on our most recent visit and she was AWESOME!
Love the cheesesteak and house-made chips, and the huge beer selction. Can be loud when there's a game on, but otherwise a good atmosphere.

We had wonderful beer, awesome waitress, and great food! My boyfriend and I wanted to try new beers and our waitress gave use three different samples of beers to try. The food was really good. My boyfriend got the Philly Cheesesteak Supreme and he loved it. I had the boneless wings. I loved it too.

We love their cheese steaks! 
We never get to try anything else bc we always crave their cheese steak with the egg on it!!! the ambiance is chill and the servers are friendly!

I really enjoy this place!  I usually sit at the bar and enjoy trying different beers.
Good pizza and cheesesteak sammis for food options.

Probably an unfair review since we didn't go inside but I felt compelled to post something about this bar anyway.
We didn't go inside because there appeared to be no less than 50 TV's mounted in the ceiling, row after row, constant motion, constant stuff on all screens (mostly sports).
If you were an ADD sports fan with a drinking issue then this is your heaven on earth.
So while the review may sound negative it could be exactly what someone is looking for, just not us. Sorry.

After eating here I realized that this place is more of a watering hole than a restaurant. Duckworths is a sports bar with a great variety of micro brews. The atmosphere is very laid back but I still don't know why it is called duckworths. I had some mommoo wings and they were pretty good. They had charred edges and a great vinegary flavor. Now the main course I had a balsamic chicken flat bread and this is where is went downhill. The crust was so flimsy all the toppings fell off and the flavors were not very appealing. I ate 2 pieces and gave up it was just poorly made. The place wasn't very busy but I found myself looking for our server a few times for drinks or napkins. This place could be great but right now it is just ok.

I stopped into Duckworth's early evening on a Saturday for a bite to eat before a cut of the hairs. I snagged a stool at the bar and grabbed the beer list. I'd say you are looking at about 50 on tap and 50 more in the bottle. You shouldn't be disappointed with their selection of brews. 

I ordered a cheesesteak sandwich that arrived in no more five minutes! It was average with some fairly standard sweet potato fries. 

I'll be back to check out DWs when Stone Brewing comes to down to take over the taps!
My favorite spot when in the area for a few days! Can't beat the beer selection, and they have awesome wings and barbecue.  Great lunch and daily specials too.
Buffalo chicken nachos are the best and great service love the wings and burgers I eat hear at least twice a week and drive all the way from Gastonia

Excellent staff and great food and hospitality with a hip uptown flavor!
  If you want to go to bar with your colleagues in a central atmosphere maybe before or after an event-Duckworth's on North Tryon is the ideal location. Young good looking people  that really are there to make sure you are well served. Very friendly and energetic.

I loved the old Duckworth's, so yesterday we decided to check out the changes.  I reviewed the Huntersville location at 5 stars previously, this one I would give 3.5, kindly bumping it to 4 for Yelp.

We called the Ballantyne location since they are closer to us about dogs on the patio, which they said no, so then we called Park Road and they said yes, so we ended up at the Park Road location.  They immediately seated us on the patio and brought water out for the pup.  A++ on that.

The new menu...while I appreciate the new simplicity, they took away a lot of my favorites.  My favorite app (banana peppers), my favorite drink (peach martini), and some good menu options (wraps).  This is one reason they lose stars for me.  Just sadness to see some great options go.

The food this time (starters)..we started with the fried cauliflower.  I wasn't interested in the sauce choices, so we went with buffalo, which they were willing to do.  It was not what I expected for fried, but it was really good!  However, when I go out, I like things that I don't make at home or would be difficult/time consuming to make at home.  The buffalo cauliflower just tasted like steamed cauliflower in sauce, something I could easily make at home as a side - another reason to miss the banana peppers!  So while I would say it's good, I would not get again.  

The food this time (meal)..Kevin had the chorizo burger and I had the supreme Philly sandwich.  Both were great.  No complaints here.

The new decor...while it is lovely and the patio looks nice, the seating was not comfortable.  I guess they want to get you in and out.

Service was fantastic.  Fast and our server was attentive, bringing us our every request and prompt to refill our drinks.

While I welcome the updates, I also miss the old Duckworth's more.

My cousin has worked the bar scene in Charlotte for a decade and normally takes me to Taco Mac, but with it being a NFL Sunday and Taco Mac slammed we came here. The food is comparable to Taco Mac, as is the service, but this is a smaller footprint with great TV, less noise and a more low-key crowd. She ordered wings, which she enjoyed and I ordered a chicken salad, which was fine. Yep, the food isn't to rave about, but it's puts Hooter's to shame.

I'd give them a 5, but sometimes there is something lacking to my order, or they burn my food. They always make up for it, so I'll still give them a 4, because it is really good when done right!

I Always get the flat bread! Yum!!! I get the margarita and i request the tomatoes to be chopped and extra buffalo mozzarella cheese. It's so good!

I almost always get there scrumptious beer battered onion rings. They come out nice and plump. There are no shrimpy sheds of onion here. 

Recently, I had the cheese sticks and loved them!! The outside is nice. It's not that crumbly seams almost like hard little pieces of corn. It's awesome! Highly recommend them!!

The last time I sat outside and the first pizza was burnt, and the second was cold. The manager apologized, he would have made another, but I felt like two times was enough to wait. He took it off the bill and sent me on my way with some hot tasty donuts.

Awesome sandwiches.  Haven't been to the new location yet but, I'm sure it's just as good.  Ask for the Sriracha sauce; they keep it hidden in the back.
*Update: Just visited the new place.  Much better location and interior.  Lots of TVs, nice layout and HUGE beer menu.

Great place, great food, great service all around. Big selection of beer, and you are able to sample if you prefer before you order your drink. Manager checks on your table to make sure we are getting great service, gentleman that waited on us was so very polite. We will defiantly be returning with family and friends.
The remodel of the place looks great.  They are hand breading the tenders now, much better than before.  Cheese steaks are still great.  We will continue to visit this location.

This is a great place in Charlotte! They have a ton of draft beers on tap and the food is amazing! We got the buffalo chicken pizza and it was so delicious! It was huge and we are left overs the next day. We also got the twisted chicken sandwich but per the waitress's suggestion we made it a wrap. So delicious! Blacken chicken with some spicy mayo and I recommend a side of garlic fries. You won't be disappointed. This is one of the best restaurants in Charlotte and the staff is awesome! Super nice and attentive and the managers are fantastic. I highly recommend stopping by one night.

Can't wait to try this place again!  Excellent beer and food selection!  I think anyone would be able to find something to their liking here!  The menu looked so go I had a hard time deciding what to get.  I went with the cheese steak and it was yummy!  Bread tasted super fresh too which I LOVE!

Compared with Duckworth's in Ballantyne, this place was a bit of a disappointment last time. While service in Ballantyne is ridiculously friendly and helpful, the waitress at this branch was fine but not very accomodating to special requests. We asked to get nachos without sour cream and with a little more salsa instead. Out came nachos WITH sour cream and an extra ketchup-container of salsa for which we were charged 1.50 dollar. 

Their draft beer list also seems to have shrunk quite a bit and is now much shorter than at the Ballantyne location. Not sure if this is temporary of not.

Best wings ever....can't remember a better wing. The wings that won 1st place and 3rd place at the NC wing contest were fabulous. Seasoned and marinated. Crunchy fried drenched in sauce and then chargrilled....wow.... 113 beers I had the stop drop and roll twice. I have to visit 112 more times. Service was also great....Amanda did an awesome job explaining types of beers and procedures and recommendations.  Will be in Charlotte much more. Let's go Panthers. Televisions are at every angle you turn your head. Thumbs all the way up. Keep up the great work!

Duckworths has without a doubt the best micro beer selection in town.  Sure, they only have 20 taps but those 20 are GREAT and Tues & Thurs all drafts are only $2.50!  Plus they have $2.50 draft specials EVERYDAY of the week.  Last visit they had 4 Founders taps, Allagash White, Gordon & Ten Fidy from Oscar Blues, DFH 90, Foothills Hoppyum, and many more.  PLUS they go to Black Mountian and bring back Pisgah beer....the only place in Charlotte that carries Pisgah.

The food is always fresh and very good, the pizza and cheese steaks are excellent.  BUT the fried pickles at Duckworths are the best in town...yes, better that the Penguin's!!  They are always crisp (not greasy or soggy) and you get a large serving.  

Again, the best beers and deals in town.

I really wanted to like this place, and if I went there for beer and food, I may have liked it better. That said, I just stopped in for a quick lunch. Very extensive menu from apps, to salads, to pizzas, to sandwiches to regular entrees. They ride themselves (food wise) on the sub sandwiches, especially the philly. I went with the buffalo chicken philly which came with ranch, swiss and buffalo sauce with chopped up chicken. Comes in two sizes....7" and 10". 7" was $7.99 and the 10" is $10.99. Went with the 7" as I wasn't looking to roll out of the place after wards. 

Now my issue...those prices do not come with any sides. They offer a "make it a meal" for $3.50 which includes a side & drink. Since I got an iced tea I went with a side of sweet potato fries, which were really good. However; for $11.49, my plate was no where near the size or the quality for that price. I couldn't imagine getting the 10" for almost $15! 

The beer menu was extensive and impressive, and I'll be sure to check it out one more time for the beers since I didn't on this recent trip.

We had been wanting to go to Duckworth's, but we normally went to its neighbor, Mama Fu's, instead.  Fortunately for Duckworth's, we got there and discovered that Mama Fu's had closed.  Huh.  So we finally got to give Duckworth's a try and weren't disappointed.  

We walked in and saw that the dining room was just one long aisle.  It didn't look too inviting, but it was a nice night out, so we decided to sit outside.  The service was great.  Our server was on top of things, even with the drunks next to us.  He was very cordial to them even though they were being pretty stupid.  

We had the kids with us so instead of trying their cheesesteaks (it's in the name, so they have to be good!), we decided to order two large pizzas to split.  The Meatza Pizza sounded delicious with its salami, sausage, Canadian bacon, pepperoni, AND regular bacon.  And -- BONUS! -- that just happened to be their "special" monthly pizza, on sale for $5 off!  The pizza was delicious, moist, and very flavorful; not dull or dry at all.  We were very impressed!  Next time we'll definitely try the cheesesteaks!

We enjoyed our Easter lunch here. We got the mozzarella sticks (which were awesome) a crispy chicken Caesar salad (which was good) a margarita flat bred (which had great flavor but had WAY too much olive oil on it, so ask for light oil) and a Philly cheesesteak (their cheesesteak was supposed to be the reason the restaurant opened but it wasn't good. It was just a bland cheesesteak. I've tasted a lot of cheesesteaks, and have even lived in Philly, and this one was nothing special) The price of the food is expensive for it just being bar food in a bar atmosphere, which was the ultimate reason why this review gets 3 stars instead of 4. I liked how all of the waiters and waitresses worked together as a team, especially since our waitress seemed to forget about us, like one waiter brought our food, and another one bused some dishes as he was walking by and saw they were empty. As a past waitress, I can appreciate the team effort. I would come back to eat here again, just pay more attention to the prices since they're a little high.

Beer, Beer, Beer, Beer....All this fabulous beer that I have never heard of....I will have the Bud Light Please!!!  Seriously, that's really pretty much all I drink!! 

I have come in late at night after work and have sat inside and out on the patio both are great! The service has been hit or miss but I think for the most part its been very good! The bartenders know everything about the beer so no problems there!! The prices are really reasonable too!! 

The food has been good, Nachos being my favorite! The burgers are good as well with the french fries! I think it adds something great to Montford !!

It's like Applebee's  But, local!

I'd take my dad here.  In fact, I did.
Great location food was good the restaurant  air conditioner  wasn't  working so had to eat outside  to be comfortable.

Expensive bar food and expensive beer, but some beers are worth the price.  Highly suggest going on $3 pint nights.

I went on a Friday night and 9 kegs had been tapped out and weren't replaced.  One of which was the special of the day.  If you are out of your special, make something else cheaper.  I had already eaten dinner, so I didn't need any of their overpriced food.  After I drank my one beer we left.  Outside of pint nights, I just don't think this place is for me.

We came out to Duckworth's after bowling and drinks over on South Tryon. I'd been to the location in Huntersville and really enjoyed that one, so I was excited about trying the Park Road location. When we got there and turned in from the street, I was worried that parking would be an issue, because the lot looked really narrow. We all found spots no problem, and there was a decent amount of people inside. When we left, I noticed street parking that I'm sure alleviates some of the issues that may come with a small-ish parking lot. Next time I go, I'll check to see if there is an adjoining lot in the back. Anyway, we get inside and it's bright with lots of TVs and a really diverse crowd. The hostess seats us promptly and we start perusing the menu. My sister and I decided on the salmon salad, my date ordered the famous Bold n Gold wings (24 of them, yes we all judged him lol), and my brother in law ordered the burger. We didn't have drinks since we'd been drinking at the bowling alley, but I'll definitely review those the next time we stop in. The salmon salad was delish! Crispy outside and warm, flaky inside, with just the right amount of seasoning. My date smashed his wings and fries, and took the rest home to eat while watching the game the next day. My brother in law was thoroughly impressed with his burger too. All-in-all, it was a really great dining experience and we all agreed we'd totally go back. The bathrooms were clean enough, though I only ran in quickly to wash my hands before eating. Can't speak for the stalls. I'm deducting a star because I got sick once I got home. :/ It didn't feel like food poisoning, so I'm for sure going to check Duckworth's out again. Maybe next time to watch a game and have some drinks!!

Quack, Quack!!!!  I asked my cousins where to get some sweet potato fries and she recommended Duckworth's. I proceed to look up the menu online.....the food items listed sounded very appetizing so I called in an order os Sweet Potato Fries ( with sweet sauce---sweet butter, cinnamon & sugar) YUMMY!! I also ordered loaded nachos which consisted of nachos with chicken, onions, tomato, cheese, guacamole,  sour cream & jalapeño. I picked up my food at the bar. They were very polite and friendly!! The food was ALL that and then some!!!! I will definitely go back. I had to force myself not to go back again today. A definite go to Spot,! ,!
Bartender was nice but not very attentive. Food is EXTREMELY slow! We came on a Friday and the place was next to empty and it took over thirty minutes for our food
Great beers! Foods ok. But I don't go there for the food. Make sure you have a DD. Tues and Thur $3 after tax beers.

I went here with Andrew H. so that's an automatic +1 star rating. Not that this place needs it - their beer selection is quite nummy. 

After a tasty dinner at Three Amigos my buddy and I decided to come on over to the best part of Montford for a few drinks and to chill on the patio and enjoy the spring sun. The waiter was super helpful on our arrival and recommended some brews that we were sure to enjoy.

After finishing my first stout I spotted that they sell $6 beer samplers. This is a GREAT deal because they have quite an extensive menu. I generally know what I want in a beer so everything I sampled was good (I think 2 more stouts, an IPA and a Hefeweizen). My buddy also got a sampler so we were able to mix and match.

All in all a good spot. I look forward to trying their food on the next visit.

Did not know that they stayed open late! My husband and I were looking for a good bite and nice place to chill at 11pm on a Friday night. They serve food till midnight. Staff was friendly, food came out fast and was delicious! Two thumbs up for the chorizo burger

Went to meet a friend and was excited about the beer selection. $3.50 draft night was great. However, our server gave us the feeling that we were more of an inconvenience for him. Wasn't very welcoming. The buffalo blue cheese chips could have used more toppings. My boyfriend ordered the pizza special. You receive 9 toppings for $11.99. He informed our server that he was a pescatarian (only eats seafood). The server had to ask the kitchen if he could substitute shrimp. Of course the answer was yes. About two slices in, not realizing because of how hungry we were, he noticed bacon pieces all over the pizza. When we told the server his response was "I'll have them make another one." No apology or expression at all. After that of course we didn't want another one. Took about 5 minutes for the manager to come over. Of course he apologized and took the pizza off. Feeding meat to someone that doesn't eat meat is a pretty big deal. The pizza was taken off but that was it. They even left the pizza on the table. Why would we want a reminder of the mistake that occurred and stare at a pizza you can't eat. I expect a lil more compensation for something like that. Not looking for a free meal in any way. In a situation like that, i would expect more than just taking off the mistake. I just there needs to be more personality and care from the employees and management.

Let's keep it short and sweet...here's everything you need to know about this place:

Yes parking sucks...

BUT

$3.50 drafts Tuesday and Thursday! 

Yep! Over 50 drafts on tap! It's okay go ahead and do your happy dance. I know I did! 

Order the Smothered Fries! Don't even think about passing these up. They are worth every bite. Not to mention they use REAL bacon, load them up with cheese and give you a side of ranch dressing for dipping. Shut up. So good. 

Am I a fan?! Of course!

Everything we ordered was completely disgusting. We ordered from the late night menu, I got the veggie fajitas beans and rice. They left out my tortillas in my Togo order the beans and rice were disgusting. My best friend ordered the fish tacos which ended up being some sort of strange shredded fish. My boyfriend got the salmon salad, which was ok but would've been better but the salmon was dry. They left out my garlic fries and on top of all of this disgusting food it was 91$!!! I will never eat here ever again

Great sandwiches, huge menu!  The bacon on the Club Sub is tasty.  Fries are fresh cut and rustic.  But the real star is the beer selection.  Although I'm not a beer drinker so I don't really seek them out, I haven't seen a longer bar with as many beers on tap in this town.  

I'll be back for the food and look forward to spreading the word that there's a new awesome sports bar in town.  And I can't remember the last time I wrote that out loud!
Slow service. Cold food. Spoiled meat on the chef salad. The manager comp'ed our entire meal... Yep it was that bad!
Two more visits. Everything still excellent including some of the best pizza. I haven't seen this much oil in the bottom of a pan since I switched my car to Pennzoil.  Damn it was good.

Duckworth's is a staple, "go to" each weekend! Their beer list is sure to have something for everyone with three entire pages of selections. Service is incredible and food even better. I can't last a week without their Grilled Chicken Caesar wrap and homemade chips!

Where to start? Alright, first they have an amazing beer list with locals and traditionals. Waiter knew his stuff, Kyle? I believe, and did a great job with recommendations for the beer fans at my table. 

So the pizza was outstanding my husband says and it looked good too! The other guest at our table and I tried the philly cheese steaks....I have to be honest and say it was 'ok' but nothing I was melting over. Atmosphere was great and if we lived in the area I would go back and continue to explore the menu.

Yes, yes, and yes! After starving for the entire day (from losing my keys and looking for them the entire day.... yup, it was one of those nights), I told my friend I wanted to eat the heartiest meal ever. MEAT PLEASE!

So I decided to get the chicken wings and pork ribs combo. I'm such a fan when ribs are tender. My face simply lights up like a mofo. The wings were less desired but still have an honorable mention. On both, I chose the Sweet n' Bold Gold Sauce but next time, I'm definitely getting the garlic parm wings!!!! (Two of my favorites)

For the sides, the tater tots were the BOMB dot com. It was cooked perfectly where it's crispy on the outside and softer inside. But the sauteed veggies were extremely thin and watery.

So if you ever lose your keys and are almost starving to death, get my meal! It'll totally satisfy your needs.

My boyfriend and I stopped in here over the weekend as I had heard about the great beer selection.  We had no idea what to expect otherwise and we were pleasantly surprised.  The beer selection is outstanding and well priced.  Looking at the specials menu, it seems like they have great specials everyday of the week!
We tried the wings and they were amazing!  The menu is pretty extensive and is better than the average bar food... I had tacos and my boyfriend opted for the Carolina BBQ.  We were both very happy with our meals.  The portions were also very generous so we had leftovers.
Prices are reasonable and this place is very casual and has a good atmosphere. It's a great place to grab dinner or just grab a beer in the bar and watch a game.  Lots of TVs all around.  We will definitely be back!

I have been here several times and it has always been an exceptional experience. The servers are always quick, friendly, and attentive. The food is always delicious and my favorite thing to get usually is one of their burgers. I highly recommend this place.

Yummy food, awesome draft beer, and great service in a casual and fun atmosphere.  I have been driving by all of their locations and I am happy that I finally decided to stop in on Park Road.  Ryan was funny and took great care of us....and the food was delicious, upscale comfort food.

The hubby and I enjoy Duckworth's and we try to make it here weekly for the awesome beer special ($2.50 pints on Tuesdays and Thursdays).  This is Mr. P's favorite bar/restaurant because of the reasonable price and extensive selection of draft beer.  I'm not a huge beer drinker myself but even I get excited reading the beer menu.  My husband, on the other hand, acts like a kid in a candy store and spends a ridiculous amount of time salivating over the beer menu while trying to make his selections.  The restaurant is in a great location (park road shopping area) and the management and servers are extremely friendly and helpful.  If you have a hard time deciding on a beer the servers are more than happy to let you try samples before committing.  The dining area indoors is a little boring (off white walls with little to no decorations), but the outdoor area is nice with plenty of people watching.  And, if you're lucky, you can sometimes even hear the trivia from across the street at Angry Ale's in the evening.  The menu is pretty decent with a good variety of appetizers, salads, sandwiches, pizzas and entrees.  I highly recommend the cobb salad.  It's easily enough for 2 meals and so delicious loaded up with a balance of healthy (lots of veggies and grilled chicken) and unhealthy (blue cheese, cheddar, bacon, yum!)   toppings.  I always dread trying to find a parking spot in their tiny parking lot.  You're usually better off just parking along the street.  Overall, if you are (or want to become) a beer drinker this is definitely a place you need to try.

Recently stopped into Duckworths after a day spent on Montford Drive. This was my firist visit to this location, since the one at Ballantyne is just around the corner from work & home.  On this vist, we were just stopping in for drinks and did not have anything to eat. The place was not tremendously busy since we arrived before busy dinner hour. However, service was a bit on the slow side. Of course, they have a great selection of beer, so that sort of helps make up for the so-so service.

Went here for lunch one day and the food was surprisingly fresh for a bar type environment. The only downside was the noise level and this was during the lunch hour. Other than that, it did not disappoint.
great place to hang and watch sports .... great beer from what i hear (not a beer fan)..Food is always spectacular  and we always have had excellent service....

Me and two other people went to Duckworth for the first time and it was after 10pm, so it was one of the few restaurants open during the week at this time so we thought we'd try it out. We walk in and it looked pretty empty but it didn't matter cause we were hungry. There was someone sitting at the host stand and we were waiting for her to greet us and she just stared at us and when we asked where we sit or what we do she just said someone is about to come. We end up finding out that it was the manager, which was very unprofessional how she treated us. I even asked if they needed bartenders and the server told me she'd come talk to me and she never did. The server was very nice and welcoming and explained the menu thoroughly. When the beer samples came out she didn't tell us which sample was what, which made it confusing to choose. The food was tasty, but my friend said the burger he got wasn't medium well as he asked. Me and my boyfriend got sweet potato fries and asked for honey mustard. The honey mustard was very zesty which is unusual for honey mustard, it was almost spicy. Overall I enjoyed this experience but as a fellow bartender/past server I would've done things differently.
A very tasty cheese steak and home made chips. The server was pleasant and efficient in waiting on me.

If beer heaven was a place, and I'm not ruling out the possibility that it is, Duckworth's is on the shortlist for hosting duties. They boast 40 taps plus a plethora of bottled choices and the beer menu, a four page, single spaced affair, backs them up. As for food, the menu covers nearly every corner of American cuisine, from ribs to wings to pizza to Philly cheesesteaks.

To beer fans I cannot recommend the sampler highly enough: for $5 you a 4.5 oz glass of any 4 beers on tap. We visited shortly after a Stone tap takeover so that fine brewery had a draft plurality and since their choices were rarer the Stone sampler was $8, but still well worth it since it gave the opportunity to compare across the brand. All bottled choices are available for takeout, so consider bringing a treat home for your own brew reserve.

The food is enjoyable but not exceptional. I has a meatball sub with sweet potato fries. The meatballs were distinctly not house-made, but I wouldn't really expect otherwise from a one-stop shopping style kitchen. My roommate had a cheesesteak and it avoided the common misstep of being either overly greasy or juicy. All in all a solid effort.

The atmosphere was clean and more stylish than the 6 tvs above the bar broadcasting various sports events might make you expect. The staff was friendly though a bit slow and our check had to be corrected due to erroneous splitting.

Next time I OD on PBR I know where I'll be going to renew my faith in craft beer, and Duckworth's is that place.

Underwhelmed, disappointed and regretful. Those three words sum up my visit to Duckworth's Grill & Taphouse. I brought a large group here on a Saturday evening (they weren't too busy when we got there) at the recommendation of a friend and I found it to be completely disappointing. We had 7 in the group. Everything about the place was disappointing. We weren't asked for a drink order for 15 minutes; our food order wasn't taken for 45 minutes to an hour; the food came another 30 minutes later; and the food was well below average. I ordered a 16 oz porterhouse steak with sweet potato fries and grilled veggies. The porterhouse was a little overcooked and had a mushy exterior with no grill marks or char as if it had been cooked on a grill that wasn't hot enough (or a Foreman grill). The sweet potato fries were decent but there were hardly any of them. The grilled veggies were mushy and served in a pool of what appeared to be oil...yuck. They did have a decent sample of beers here which is nice but I would never go here again for a meal. All told I left feeling like I had wasted 2 plus hours of my life waiting on food that I'd rather have not have eaten.

Sunday 12/17. Our family of four, including myself, walk in around 8 for a couple drinks and some dinner. As a side note, the place was barely a quarter full at this time so there should be no excuse for slow service. The first issue we encountered was waiting 30 minutes, yes you read that right, for our beers. Our waiter quickly brought them to the table after complaining as to where they were. Besides the incredibly slow service, which seems to have reputation around that establishment, the worst part of the night was encountering Alyssa, the store manager. She was by far the rudest manager I've ever "met". Besides comping one of our dinners they messed up, which still took an hour to serve, she had the audacity to raise her tone of voice and talk back to us when telling her about the poor service we received that night. I rarely write reviews but because the way we were treated by Alyssa and the poor service, I felt inclined to let other's know to avoid that spot. Between slow service and awful, AWFUL customer service from the staff, especially Alyssa, we will no longer eat at that establishment and would recommend others to find a better place to eat instead.

I would like to start out by saying that this was my first time visiting Duckworth.  My experience with this restaurant was amazing.  The food was amazing and the server was on top of his job. The atmosphere was comfortable. I have to say that I have found a wonderful place to go hang out to eat and enjoy nice people.

We have been to this location many times and I always have amazing service! The food is incredible and the service is awesome. I love that you can get char grilled wings and the beer selection is like no other in Charlotte! You'd be crazy not to make this part of your lunch or dinner!

We spontaneously stopped by here in hopes of getting a table quickly because we were getting hangry. The guy told us it would be 25-30 minutes and we ended up getting a table in about 15 minutes. The service was super slow and the food took forever to come out. I don't know if that was the hunger talking, but it literally felt like we've been sitting there forever. I ordered the Baja Fish Tacos and I really enjoyed the pineapple chunks in the tacos and in the salsa. The chips that came with the taco were so salty that salt would fall and stick to my fingers. My tacos needed more seasoning because it was pretty bland. We also witnessed a couple sitting there for quite sometime without a single person coming by to even ask what they wanted to drink. The couple angrily stood up and left in a hurry. They left so fast that the lady left her purse in the restaurant. That's not okay! I honestly don't know if I'll be back.

This place has great food and great beer. The cheesesteaks are absolutely amazing. I had the supreme with tots. I have also had the smokehouse cheesesteak which is also fantastic. I would definitely recommend anyone to come here.
I love the remolded Duckworth's! Food was great! Th  manager was very friendly and knowledgeable. The restaurant smelled so good! Which made me eager to eat! I will be back!

They have a policy of carding everyone who orders alcohol.  I think those policies are too rigid and just kinda harass people who are plenty old enough to drink.  I refuse to order alcohol at and place with such policies.

For those of you who don't care about my stand against invading privacy...their food is really good.  Much better than other places in town with so many beers (Taco Mac, Flying Saucer).  Their cheesesteaks are the signature dish, but even their salads are pretty good.  
They have a great selection of beer and run good specials during the week (now $3.50, formerly $3) on pints so the bar gets packed on those nights.  
Parking is a problem since the lot in front is small so you may need to park on Montford or in the adjacent shopping center and walk.

First Duckworths I visited, still a favorite even if I don't frequent this as often as I'm not on this side of town as much. Still highly recommend, though Montfort has a lot of other great offerings.

Dined in once, did take out once. Food was vey tasty on both occasions. The staff is very friendly and fun to converse with. I found myself eating just apps instead of an entrée and was perfectly satisfied doing so. Boneless wings - juicy and flavorful. Mozzarella sticks/fried cheese - the best I've had yet!

Decent place in Charlotte to get beers, food and to watch a game. 

The draft list was a bit overwhelming to read since it was in an excel spreadsheet on a piece of paper and tiny to read. I will have to say that there were a lot of higher gravity options which I prefer not to have while enjoying a longer game so I went with an Allagash White with an orange slice. 

For food, we started out with the Buffalo Bleu Cheese Chips which were great. For my meal, I decided to go with the Gorgonzola and Apple Flatbread with a side salad while Boyfriend ordered the Cobb Salad. Food was decent, nothing to write home about. 

My one complaint was when we were leaving the hostess kept asking us multiple questions about how our visit was. I thought that a simple, have a great day and thank you for coming would do.

This is our new favorite spot! The food was great, I had the chicken pesto sandwich and yum! It was delicious. My husband had ribs and wings, both great. The grilled corn is amazing too. 

I am not a beer drinker but our server Ryan noticed that I like Frambois and suggested some different beers that were really good! We will definitely be going back!

This was my first time at Duckworth's to watch Sunday football.  A large group of us sat at the long high top table in the bar area.  
We had awesome service with David!  The nachos are a must try and the extensive beer list was great.  Thumbs up all around.
We were able to see all of the games unlike a lot of other local bars.  We will definitely return!

I've been rocking with Duckworth's since 2009 when it was Duckworth's Cheese Steakery on Park Rd. Their food is very savory and delcious. If you're a beer lover, they have tons of beer on tap. They know how to do a cheese steak! I always get their Chicken Philly Cheesteak with garlic fries because it's the best chicken philly in town! You can't go wrong with their farlic fries. I like to add some old bay to my griws for an extra zip. I have alwways had great service here too. The parking is a little tight, so be cautious. 

If you want a more unique Duckworth experience, check out their new establishment, The Cellar at Duckworth's in their location uptown. You'll be taken back to the roaring 20s in the cellar of a speakeasy with delcious small plates, tons of worldy beers and hand crafted cocktails.

Visit this location often. Been here for college football bowl games or with the family on a Friday night. More restaurant than sport bar. Very accommodating staff and the menu has enough options to please the full group. Food is good, not amazing, but also priced reasonably. The beer options are overwhelming, which is good. Where I am from "4 stars out of 5" is good and Duckworth's is well worth return visits.
This place does not disappoint!  Their chicken fajita salad and their philly cheesesteak are amazing!
Excellent selection with knowledgeable staff!  Gorgonzola & apple flatbread was delicious - way better than you would expect from a bar!  Would definitely go again!

Duckworth's is a great place for anyone who loves beer. They have a great selection of beers which can sometimes be overwhelming. I asked the waiter for a suggestion and he was very helpful and educated on the beer list. I had a Great Lakes Christmas Ale and have been trying to find them in the store ever since! He made sure we didn't ever have an empty glass through the night and had lots of suggestions. 
The menu is very extensive and I have always really liked the options I've tried. This visit, I had a bacon chicken wrap and french fries. No complaints! It's really good bar food, it's not a 5 star restaurant. 
Good service, good food, great beer!

I'm not a beer conisseur so the 60 taps all standing tall do little for me.   Beyond that I don't see how this place is a riff on the iconic Philly cheese steak sandwich.   I agree with reviews that Duckworth's is like so many other large sports-bar-type watering holes with good,  but just OK food.   Taco Mac, Chilli's, Hickory Tavern, Applebee's, etc.  Not for me unless with a group hoisting our participation trophy.

The BBQ sandwich at $8.99 with slaw & garlic fries (best garlic fries I've ever tasted) was fantastic. Sunday $4 Mimosa topped it off. The beer selection is amazing! Staff and bartenders are friendly and welcoming. Great place to hang for sports!

Loved the hostess Camille, who is a dedicated and authentic Seahawks fan. If you smack talk her when your team is playing the Hawks, she'll give it right back to you. Made my first experience here memorable! #whodey

Friendly staff and good service. Good energy. Great beer selection. Nice decor. Respectable food.
Thursday night food service is very slow.
Not a good Panthers bar as their policy is to play multiple other games.

Duckworth's is a cool spot.  I have been going to this location since they opened.  Their food used to be better priced.   what happened to $7 chicken nachos ya bastids? Their beer menu as of late can be very hit or miss.  I think they need to get more locals in like trip C, birdsong, noda, and mix it with rarer beers to this area.  It is usually a decent time, but some things have changed for the worst.
so good! great food, great drinks, and titi our server was PHENOMENAL will definitely be visiting again-especially if she's working!

The beers are excellent.  HUGE selection, including lots of obscure and local stuff.
The wings are very good. 
The rest of the food is decent but certainly not special.

Treat this place like a beer joint and you'll be fine.
Fajita Quesdilla was huge but the cheese didn't have much taste.  Great location & good service.  Salads are huge.  Standard pub fare.

Great location off of Park Road! I've passed this place numerous times and finally decided to drop in with some friends.

They have an overwhelming amount of beers...in a good way if you want to try something new. However, if you have problems making a decision, do not look at the beer list. $2.50 pint specials on a certain selection of beers on Thursdays makes for a nice time out! I didn't eat anything during this visit, but the menu looked like a typical bar menu with salads, sandwiches, etc. They stay open with full-menu until 2am.

Smoking is allowed on the patio, there are tvs lining the walls, and did I mention they have a lot of beer?! Go enjoy a night out at Duckworth's!
The food was quick and delicious but the service was bad..our waitress seemed lost and even charged our credit card the wrong amount...i woukd go back but i need a different waitress

I can't believe I've never given Duckworth's a Yelp Review before!!! What the F$%@# was I thinking? Easily the best BEER bar in Charlotte, with about 60 on Tap and many more available by the bottle.

It's not huge in there, but they do have a nice bar area which can get quite crowded, especially at peak times (e.g., sporting events on TV). 

The service is always good, and the food surprisingly is good too! You never know what you'll be getting food wise at a bar, but Duckworth's delivers in all areas. I'd say their food is 3.5 to 4.0 stars. I mean, I wouldn't come out of my way for the food, but it's the incredible selection of draft and bottled beers that draw people to this place.

They of course serve a large selection of NC-made beers, but also have some HEAVY hitting micro-brews from all over the world. Me being a Strong Belgian ale kinda guy, I am always drawn to a great Gulden Draak, which they have ON TAP. Also have a nice selection of "high gravity" beers, many over 10% ABV. 

If you love beer, this is your place. I like Duckworth's SO much better than World of Beer (no food, WTF?) and Flying Saucer up north. But those places also serve a nice selection of beers. Maybe because Duckworth's is in my neighborhood AND it has a great vibe is why I like it so much.

But if you're into great beers, good food and a place that won't force you to miss your monthly mortgage payment, come check out Duckworth's.
Yes the beer list is extensive but staff is always willing to help!  Great food and atmosphere too!

I have been hearing about Duckworths for quite some time so my wife and I decided to give it a shot. We were not disappointed.

The place is a little on the small side, just one aisle of booths and tables. There is also a seperate small bar area at the front of the space. Several TV's. Not big on the atmosphere. The only saving grace in this area is the outside seating.

The food is decent. We split a full cheesesteak, and the blue cheese chips. Not the greatest cheesesteak but not bad at all. A good value for the price.

The waitstaff is pretty good, they seem to be on top of things. Checked in on us often, made sure we had everything that we needed, and weren't too pushy. 

Duckworths is  a beer-centric place with a great beer menu. They currently have 20 beers on tap, and are constantly rotating their tap list to keep it interesting. Another thing that I really like is that they know how to serve their beer, in the correct glassware, at the right temperature. They are not serving Natty lite in a frosted mug. They have a very good list of bottles available too. They have great specials too Mon & Wed is $2.50 local (N.C.) drafts, Tues & Thurs is $2.50 all drafts, Fri, Sat & Sun they pick 2 or 3 draft to be $2.50.

I understand that they are in the process of moving into a larger space on Park Rd. I believe they said they should be operational by the end of May. I am told they will have 60 beers on tap, and 3 casks

All in all a great place for a beer fan, a family, or just someone looking for a decent meal at a reasonable price.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
UPDATE

Duckworths has recently opened their new location on Park Rd. and it is terrific. The place is much larger and more up to date than the previous location. 

The service is as good as ever and now they have 60 taps with some great craft beers and a cask engine. Really the premier spot for craft beer in the Charlotte area.

I am really impressed, I am usually there at least once a week and have never had a bad experience.

If I could leave zero stars I would. We went to eat Saturday night around 5:30 and had a dark haired waitress. She got our drinks out promptly but then took 25 minutes to come back and ask us what we wanted to eat. I wanted one of their flatbreads but as a pizza. Seems simple enough, right? Well.... the food didn't come out until 6:30-6:45. Mind you there was maybe three tables in the entire restaurant at this point. All of the servers were talking at the hostess stand and my waitress was no where to be found. She didn't check in once and neither did a manager. When the food finally came out a blonde manager brought it out and apologized on it taking so long. There was no explanation as to why it took so long. And if she brought it out she must have known it took a long time- if she was aware why had she not greeted the table within the hour of us waiting for our food? So anyways.. she brings the food out and my order was wrong. It was a flatbread. So she apologized and it told me it would take another five minutes. Twenty minutes later after everyone is done with their food my personal size pizza finally comes out. Terrible service and terrible management. Will not be back.

This is a fancy restaurant. However they accommodated me at the bar as I wore jean that night. 

Their wine is excellent. Their lamb shank is pricey but worth it.

Good beer. Great bartender.  Definitely would recommend. Make sure to try their cheese steak, fries and deal of the day. It's a good atmosphere and is nice for close friends, couples and coworkers. I'd recommend it anytime!
This place has a fun atmosphere! I got the chicken nachos and they were really good and huge!

Been to this location a few times and twice since reopening. Service is great and has been every time.  The last two times I have ordered the Big Bad Burger and this last time it was just a little over cooked (Requested Medium , came close to medium well)  but was still tasty and tender. Ordered the house cut fries and they were great as well. I feel this is a great spot to grab good food or go to watch a game !  Not a drinker but I have always heard they have a great beer selection.

I stumbled across this gem on accident when trying to find a place to grab a bite, but not being from the area. Good Lord was I happy to find this place and its 150 beers on tap. My friend and I were literally amazed by the wall of beer choices and the even larger number of TVs. (I straight up asked the waiter how many there were.) Regardless, we were given the drink menu-which was an iPad- that had not only the regular choices, but also any type of mix you could imagine. Then there was the food menu, pretty much anything that you may crave while drinking. Flatbreads, tacos, cheesecake, you name it. We ordered and waited only about 15 min for the food, which tasted pretty good. I recommend the flatbread over my wrap but hey, both were satisfying.
The only reason I gave this place 4 instead of 5 stars was the wait staff. They were pretty unhappy to be there. I've worked in food & bev and no one wants a boring waiter. 
Nonetheless, I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good place to grab a drink. It can hold just a few people or large parties..not to mention there is a different TV and beer for everyone!!

The food was great and the service was fabulous. We come here occasionally and always enjoy and today we decided to come after church and the service was exceptional as well as the food. I had the Chorizo Burger and I would eat it daily if my wife would let me. Tremendous choices of craft beers but also domestics for those that don't like to try new things. I cannot say how great this place is.

I stopped by Duckworth's Kitchen & Taphouse when checking out the Ballantyne area of Charlotte after a friends wedding in South Carolina. First off the Ballantyne area of Charlotte is super nice. A plethora of huge corporate buildings and nice homes and shops. Most of the restaurants I saw were chains that I had already been to and I wanted to try something new and different. This lead me to Duckworth's.

I sat at the bar to watch some of the US Open golf. They have an insane amount of beers on tap and I had a couple of lemon Kolsch which were really good. The food menu is fairly typical for this kind of restaurant/bar with offerings of wings, burgers, cheesesteaks, pizza, sandwiches, and salads. I decided on the BBQ sandwich with onion rings and it was satisfying (About as good as you would expect outside of Eastern NC). 

Actually, Duckworth's is somewhat of a mini-chain with several locations in the Charlotte area (I asked). It's really not that unique inside or with the food they offer. I would compare it to a Carolina Ale House, but slightly better. I am giving 4 stars because I was pleased overall with my choice to stop by Duckworth's.

The best part about coming to Duckworth's is the beer. With that being said, the best days to come and enjoy a beer are Tues & Thurs when most of the 50 or so beers they have on draft are $3.00. Those are the best nights to come and experiment with new beers and try something different. The food is a little bit above average bar food, nothing special going on here. The service isn't bad either. Be warned, if you come on $3 beer night it might be tough to find a table.

After driving place after place last night trying to find something good we decided on Duckworths.  We get there walk in the manager is on the phone having a personal phone call.  I asked should we seat ourselves or what because it had been about 3 minutes or so and she had not so much as acknowledged us.  Then she pulls the phone away from her head and asks one of the servers to please seat us.  He asks us where we preferred to sit and we ended up picking the dark booth.  He explained the options and specials and tells us about the specials.  Not sure what his name was but he was super nice.  Looking at the menus we see that alot has changed here.  I didn't know this until reading some other reviews but they relaunched recently and changed a lot of stuff.  Our server came and told us that yes they are testing new concepts for the chain.  I ended up getting a burger with sweet potato fries and it was pretty good except I received the burger well instead of medium like I requested since they asked.  My friend's got a order of sweet potato fries.  The honey mustard was not that great it had to much zest we asked about that and were told they use a Dijon in it which is why it was that way.  Me on the other hand got ranch with my fries and it was pretty  good.  While we were eating the manager walked by our table and again couldn't be bothered to acknowledge anyone.  It's bad customer service when you act like that.  If it was me I'd definitely be checking in with guests to make sure they are having a good experience.  I don't know if I'm really wanting to give them another go because I felt like I got ripped off honestly.  Almost $30 bucks for a burger, fries and draft on special.  What was sad is they pretty much have the same amount of fries in the side that they gave on the appetizer. I'm a fan of the metal plates though. I think I liked the old Duckworths better.  Please check your female manager she was pretty rude during the whole visit.

Visited last week, they have a huge beer list, like 200 beers, I wish it was a bit colder but with the selection it was still great.  Had a plain old bacon cheeseburger, the menu says it's fresh made to order never frozen and that's just how it tasted, I sit here 10 days since being there and I'm craving that burger. I'll be back.

Yum.  I have been here a few times and have ALWAYS had good service.  Servers seem always be helping each other out.  Severs know the menu quite well. Try to hit it on the off times becuse parking is stressful.

Duckworths park road is always a great time. We often sir at the bar and have great service. There are not many spots offering potato skins, and I love the skins with jalapeño bacon. Alex is a fantastic bartender and quick to offer a beer based on my previous orders. But wait. There's more. Every Tuesday and Thursday most beers are $3.50!

Good food and great beer selection! My husband and I go all the time, and we haven't had a meal there that we didn't like. Getting the special is usually a good idea. The beer at Duckworth's though is even better than the food. It's the best place in Charlotte for craft beer IMO.

Came here once for a day lunch on a Saturday. They let you bring your dogs and we sat outside - I had a beer and the buffalo chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries - slightly above average but the sitting outside was the best part. 

Went back a week later for the evening drinking festivities and the inside beer selection was great, stayed for two drinks and bolted down Montford...

Duckworth's is one of my favorite places to go for lunch and/or dinner when I want good, american fare. I've been dining here ever since I moved to Charlotte, and at one point considered myself a regular.

First, they have an extensive beer selection, most of which are on tap. They also have a beer club you can join and earn points towards prizes. My favorite is actually their strawberry whit blend. So fruity and refreshing! Their food is delicious and they have everything from burgers to salads, ribs to fajitas, tacos to desserts. They also have a kick-ass philly cheesesteak, and being from Philly, I'm allowed to say that lol 

They have a large indoor seating area, bar seating and cute outdoor patio seating. The service is typically good, you may have a fluke every once in a while. If you're looking for good, filling fare, this is your place. It's also really close to other restaurants and bars in Montford.
I enjoyed eating there today and seeing how it was renovated. The food and drinks were scrumptious. Ken, a manager, and Brett, a server, were helpful.
Awesome beer selection and the nachos are the best! Tues/Thurs $3.50 draft beers are a great deal!

Awesome beer selection and a great place to watch Sunday ticket. However eat before you leave the house, even for bar food it was pretty bad. If I could I'd give it 5 stars for pretty much the best on tap beer selection in Charlotte and 2 stars for the food

Went  to the soft opening of Duckworth's. i made a new restaurant since they changed their name, location and updated the menu. So, maybe this should be linked to Duckworth's Cheesesteakery. 

i was a big fan of the Cheesesteakery, but while  their old location was in a good spot the inside was extremely limited.  Now the inside is much more open, inviting and improved.
