They've also revamped the menu from what i can tell adding fancier steaks and such (don't remember seeing them before), but holding over the good stuff.  

We had some fried mushrooms which were okay. Nothing special, just something fried.  The jalapeno chicken was extremely delicious. Regular price is $14.99 but i think it was worth the price. The wife thoroughly enjoyed it. i can't resist ordering the buffalo Philly cheesesteak. i've never been to Philly, so maybe my taste buds don't know the 'real' thing. But i thoroughly enjoy it with their sweet potato fries.  Delicious.

They were my favorite place to get good draft beer before, and now they increased from 20 to like 60 beers on draft! It is a beautiful thing. With $2.50 specials on ALL beer on Tuesday and Thursday, i don't know of a better place in the area. Every day there is supposed to be select $2.50 drafts. 

The only drawback appeared to be the parking situation which is somewhat limited.

Great place! Ive been here a couple times after work (which is very convenient since i get off late and nothing else is open in the area after 11) they have great service with full knowledge and great suggestions about the beer on tap. Always have a good experience coming and and leaving satisfied. 

At this location they have draft specials on tues and thursday which is awesome! Ive had the pizza which was great all the way down to he crust! Loaded tater tots with bacon cheese and sour cream (yum) and the chicken fajitas! The food is a bit pricey but you get a large portion. Did i mention there are pizza specials on tuesdays?! Another gem that i would become a regular at! 

Great place awesome food and nice people!

We love this spot to watch sports on the many tvs or to meet up with friends for a late lunch or dinner.
This is also a good choice for groups because the menu is really extensive and offers something for everyone. We enjoy the pizza, the herb crust is amazing, and perfect with some ranch on the side. I also enjoy their salads and sandwiches. I think this is also a good place to have a few beers and appetizers, especially cheese and bacon fries!

Amazing selection of beers and delicious chicken wings. Very lively atmosphere and am sure everyone would love the staff, they are very sweet, friendly and helpful. Thanks Alex you were really wonderful. I am hooked forever.

Food was good- very generous with their fresh mozzarella on the caprese sandwich. However, server forgot my drink until the food arrived and I didn't see her to ask. My father is 80 and wanted to watch a specific game without having to turn his head. We politely asked if we could have the channel changed, but the server came back and said "my manager said we aren't changing channels today". What kind of customer service is that?

Duckworth's is a great place to go and grab a unique craft beer and some good bar food with friends or colleagues after work. It is also a good place to catch a game, or watch America's recent obsession, the World Cup. 

The food here is much better than I expected. According to the menu, the owners of the place started Duckworth's to bring the taste of Philly down south and put their own spin on the Philly Cheese Steak. With this in mind, I ordered the Steak and Egg Philly. Now I'm not claiming to be a Philly Cheese Steak expert, because I'm far from it, but this thing was impressive. It came with grilled onions, egg, steak, and your choice of cheese. I chose Pepper Jack  of course. The steak was tender and very moist and the combination of the egg and melted cheese gave it a great texture and taste. I definitely would recommend trying it out. 

The cheese steaks aren't the only upside to this place. I've also had their wraps, which are above average for bar food. And I've heard great things about their pizzas, although I've never had it personally. 

The place has a good atmosphere that is geared toward the craft beer nerds (I embrace this title). There were tap handles lining the ceilings, a display of different craft beer bottles behind a plexi-glass window, and a map of the U.S. with the corresponding beer labels in each state. There is also a nice patio that is great for a summer's night. 

The best thing about this place is the beer. They have a rotating tap of all of the craft beers you could want. They normally have some locals (NoDa Brewing, Olde Hickory, Bird Song etc..), but they also have some favorites from around the country (Bell's, Stone, Founder's, etc...). The best way to test the waters and take advantage of the great beer selection is to get the Sampler, which is only $6. They also have a beer club where you can rack up prizes for trying all of their different beers. I'm a sucker for these Beer Club Membership rewards, and will probably end up going here 3-4 times a week. 

This is a great local option for a good craft beer, good bar food, and a good atmosphere. I will definitely continue to go and would recommend stopping in for at least a pint.
Favorite bar grill place to drink some beer and watch the games. Amazing food and great service. Just such a fun atmosphere.
Had a Philly Cheesesteak and it was great.  But even better the service was awesome.   Great selection of beers although a little early in the day for me to drink.  I can recommend this place.
Great beer selection.  Wings are on point.  It's a little dark since they renovated- not great if you are looking to hang out for lunch or daytime drinking, unless you snag a spot on their patio.

First thing that came to my mind... Long bar - long row of draft beers - yes. I came here to try out some of their beers and eat their food. I asked the bartender to give me the sampler with the highest ABV content that they had... And lets say they hooked me up.

A few stouts in, I decided to order their original Philly steak. Instead of provolone cheese though, I instead got mozzarella on it. Just because I just love that stringy cheese on it! (My friend got the white American, but we all know my cheese was more stringy)

Fries was a little bit too salty for my taste, even though they were restaurant made and cut. That isn't bad, but still a little salty. Service was great, the bartender helped me and explained all the beers and described how they tasted which helped me decide which one was the best. I had the Avery stout which was a fruity type of stout that I thought was the best. (Don't go for my word on it though, my bartender left telling me that and I'm not too sure off that info is correct) 

If I lived close by here though, I would probably come here for a beer a day. Overall, I definitely will come back here just to drink. Nice vibe, good amount of tv's for your sports junkies, and beeeeerrrrr. I definitely recommend to come by and check this place out.

great cocktails (cosmo martini) . great prices. ordered full rack ribs. loved it! wings are good too. everything we ordered as a group was not a disappointment . 
loranzo was our server and was excellent except for the fact he had TOO many tables by himself in the middle of the night but had a positive and fun attitude all night. 

will have to say one of the best tasting margaritas i had. will def come back 

.
Nice to have 58 draft beers to choose from.  Try the philly and sweet potato fries.
Love this place. The new re-model looks great. Food is always spot on and service is great.

The food? Good. The servers? Fantastic. I can't imagine any server being more attentive. This is a top notch establishment. I have had crappy days, and the servers have made it better. I especially love the Caprese sandwich, if you must ask. The servers all seem to have good suggestions. Except the bratwurst hamburger; steer clear of that unless you're a fan. The chefs are good people. Just ask around.

Great selection of solid crafts on tap.  Not the crap you find everywhere else, the good stuff.  a healthy selection of local and regionals too.  Can be a bit crowded, but service was some of the best I've had that type of environment before, including NYC.  Bartenders were always moving around and not afraid to ask if you were ready for another one.  So many times, in busy places like that, you tend to get forgotten about and passed over by louder people or people flailing their arms everywhere.  I'm quiet and I don't flail my arms, but I got plenty of prompt attention.  Do not miss if you are a craft nerd.
The parking was ok but the food was well worth it. My whole crew had pizza but it was so good. Our server was great and took good care of us. We will definitely return.

The 4 star rating is based on previous visits to Duckworths.  This place has the best cheesesteaks in Charlotte hands down!  There's also a ton of other stuff on their menu so if you can find something you like here then you've got your own issues.  Also a great beer selection.

However, my most recent visit I left, not disappointed, but more so frustrated by the service. Food was excellent per usual, but my server was dumb as a box of rocks.  I ordered a cheesesteak and CLEARLY stated that I wanted no tomatoes.  She proceeded to take the other orders from our table, and then confirmed with me before leaving that I wanted NO tomatoes again.  "Yes", I replied.  Then, she walks over to the computer to put in the order, and she yells over to me and asks if I wanted tomatoes on my sandwich...?  A bit baffled, I respond "NO".  Meanwhile, I had asked her to change the channel for one of the TV's and she said she would.  That didn't happen as we waited 25+ minutes for three cheesesteaks in a basically empty restaurant.  And then the food comes out and guess what...?  My cheestesteak has 4 ripe and juicy tomatoes sitting right on top.  And she messed up the sides for my friends sandwiches.  Picked em off and the sandwich was great!

Not hating on the place, but this girl needs to tighten up her service.  Still a fan and will be back!

I don't know about the food, but this place is all about the beer. A lot of rare stuff that I was very surprised to see on tap. This place puts Flying Saucer to shame as far as selection goes. I'd venture to say it rivals Mellow Mushroom in Asheville and Tyler's in Durham. The beer prices are EXTREMELY reasonable for such hard-to-find/eclectic selection. The sampler is a great deal (any 4 beers your heart desires for $4.50)

The new place is MUCH better than the old location when it comes to the 60 or so taps vs. the only 12 or 15 they used to have. Cool atmosphere, big bar(s) and plenty of seating. High ceilings, low lights, ESPN. I'll miss the intimacy of the old location, where we got preferential treatment on those slow nights and often got to dink around with the late-night staff. But what you sacrifice in intimacy, is more than made up for in quality AND quantity of the beer selection. A MUST when visiting Charlotte.

The service is fantastic! I met a group of my former coworkers for dinner and the waiter was very attentive and efficient. We ordered different appetizers to split and it was so good! I have never eaten anything at Duckworth's that I haven't liked!

If you gave this place five stars I'm going to kick you in the nuts. Yup Yup Yup Yuppies and wannabe hard ass types coexist inside of this place. This place goes against all the laws of nature and is a complete douchefest. If it weren't for the 60 or so drafts at 2.50 a piece I would have to take a dump on this place. Will I be back? Maybe. In all honesty the wait staff was pretty nice if not bothersome. I'm probably being too harsh. Sorry Duckworth's, I apologize and will probably come back and maybe refer some moderate friends or jerks.

Updated interior and menu makes this location better than before, but the location still makes this place a distant second to Brawley's across the street for a spot to grab a beer in good weather. 

I'm a big fan of smoked wings, so their house specialty Moommo's variety really hits the spot with some good sauce. I just was surprised to not have any ranch or celery to accompany the small tray, but I guess they really are going for a cleaner more minimalist approach or simply forgot. 

Made to order salads are a nice option, but not sure they will steal too much business from Chopt over in Park Road Shopping Center. 

The flaw here is simply the location: limited parking and a relatively small patio off to the side just do any make this a destination, but rather a good standby. 

I was also surprised that a juicy, local NE-style IPA was served in a pilsner glass, rather than a tulip or other glass to better highlight the aroma. 

I am very glad Duckworth's has a strong presence around Charlotte and cheers to their tablets to make selecting a beverage more fun with visual assistance.

Great beer selection.  Not your ordinary bar food.  Everything tasted scratch made.   Pork BBQ, gold wings, homemade chips all great.  Hubby loved his applewood bacon cheeseburger.   I  rarely eat coleslaw because I hate mayo - this slaw was fresh, cabbage crunchy, celery seed, just right amount of vinegar-based dressing.  The server, Mary, was fantastic.  She was very patient with my hubby's requests for samples.   Visiting from out of state.  If this was where we lived, we would be here all the time.  If we ever make it back to Charlotte, we will definitely return.

This establishment is close to the park road shopping center. It is in a really good location. The atmosphere is very sports bar / modern tap house feel. The managers are super nice and really want to make sure everything is ok. Shout out to the management staff. The food is incredible. The portions are what Americans should be using for portion sizing. The food is fresh to order and super delicious. I got the chicken tenders and my boyfriend got a chicken sandwich. Both were phenomenal. As you see pictured, the doughnut holes. Wow!!! Talk about incredible. Crispy on the out and airy in the middle. So amazing. I will be back.

Great execution on the neighborhood sports bar with huge beer selection, family atmosphere, and great food. My favorite is the Chicken Philly Cheesesteak. Try it with their delicious fries or go for the side salad!

My review of this place is super late considering the fella and I come here at least once or twice a month.

Unlike some other places, DWs puts as much emphasis on quality as quantity. The 60 taps are always thoughtful, sometimes rare, and obviously plentiful. The bartenders are incredibly knowledgeable, and they take their beer seriously, but they aren't snooty about it. The fella is a beer nerd, and I'm a total novice, and we both love it. Even the food is surprisingly delicious for "bar food."

We typically go during the day on a Saturday, so neither the parking lot nor the inside is very crowded, but this is always our go-to when we're looking for a comfy, casual place to drink. There are a bazillion TVs in the bar and the restaurant, and they have free wi-fi, so it's a great place to watch a game or just hang out with friends.
Nice atmosphere and a little bit of everything on the menu to satisfy anyone in your group. Staff is knowledgable about the beer they serve and very polite and courteous and quick.
Awesome place. Waiter Ryan was amazing. Very helpful in beer/food selection. Fast service, good food and great beer selection. Will definitely be back very soon! So happy it's in the neighborhood:-)
My husband and I dined at Duckworths downtown.  I had the grilled salmon and it was excellent.  The atmosphere was very good.  I highly recommend this restaurant.
Disappointed to arrive to a closed restaurant. They are currently remodeling.i did not see anything to indicate when they'll reopen.

They have the best draft beer selection in the neighborhood! And Tuesdays and Thursdays are $3.50 pint nights. If you're a single gal, it's very man heavy those nights ;) The food can be hit or miss sometimes. But they have the best fried pickles in town and I do like the Smokehouse Philly. Overall, it's a good place to hang for beers.
Great beer, great cocktails, great service at the bar, and probably the best wings you will ever eat.  The rest of the food, however, for me is just ok. Go for the wings.  You won't regret it!

Highly impressed with the service and food this New Year's Eve night.  The restaurant was pretty full when we arrived around 8pm, but since we informed them we were there just for dinner and not the 10pm party, we were seated immediately at a table that would be moved eventually for the dance floor area.  We had very attentive and cheerful service from Kendra, our drinks were quickly refilled when needed, and the food was delicious as always.  Whenever I crave chicken fajitas, this is my go-to place.  Our daughter loves the pepperoni and basil pizza, and they have some very tasty, lightly breaded, fried pickles.  Nice way to end the old year and start the new!

Duckworths open Uptown Charlotte.  Good luck! Sitting there with three gentlemen talking and got cut off they have a corporate beer limit.  We explained we live two blocks away but that was it get out. We are concern about your safety, thanks mom! Nothing like a 20 something telling you how to behave.  Seems they were more interested in not serving us, that is what happens when lawyers own a bar.  
Food, bar fare, can get anywhere in town where I am welcome.  This place is for bankers for HHour they  will love it, after 6:43 the locals will go to where everyone knows there name.  Frat boys and bankers if that is your crowd you will be welcome. If you a neighbor stay away.
They are really known for the outstanding beer selection but their food is good as well! Some things that I recommend are the wings, the cheesesteaks and the brisket tacos.

This place closes at two am every day so you can come almost any waking moment and have their yummy boneless wings in almost any sauce you want!  

parking is annoying because the lot is small and they share it with a couple of other places but keep driving around and youll find something!

We were looking for Lancasters and ended up here.. which was good bc the food was pretty good! 

I had the philly with onion and mushroom and white american cheese and the homemade chips and it was all delicious. The sandwich had a lot of flavor without being really greasy (as cheesesteaks often are) and the chips were a good mix of crispy and soft that I expect when I'm getting homemade chips. 

Other dishes at the table - chicken club sandwich (reportedly VERY good) and a cheeseburger (reported as Ok, but he ate it all so it couldnt have been too bad!!)

Note: They had the BEST Sweet tea I've had in a few years. Really super delish.
I'd definetely go back here.

Started with pickle chips which were ok. Not great but good. 

For dinner my co-worker had both the bold n gold wings and the hot wings. She said both were good but gave an edge to the hot wings. 

I had the chorizo burger. It was good.   The side salad was a generous portion with cucumbers, tomatoes and cheese and not iceberg lettuce (thumbs up)!  The coleslaw was not doing it for me. One bite and that was it. 

Service was great. Drinks refilled timely. Team effort by the servers to make sure food was brought out promptly. Think we had 4 different servers bring us one thing or another. 

Lots of TVs is you want to catch a game and the menu is huge so very likely to find something you would like. 

Definitely will be back.

I've been to two Duckworth's in the area and this one is far superior to the one in Ballantyne. The beer menu is endless and amazing but the real attraction here is the cheesesteak. I've been here probably 6+ times and although I tell myself to order something other than the cheesesteak, I simply can't resist. I've had many cheesesteaks in Philly and this is just as good if not better than many of Philly's own famous spots (I'm looking at you Pat's, Gino's and Tony Luke's). I get it with onions and cheese whiz, quite frankly, if you get it any other way, I'm going to judge you and we probably can't be friends. The fries and onion rings are also always on point.

Although the beer list is MUY overwhelming, they introduced me to FRIED BANANA PEPPERS and I'm hooked! Love it and their salads. Don't order take out on the wknd though. We called in. Got there in 20(tho they said 15) and Still had to wait almost 30 friggin minutes for two salads. No bueno...I'll go back during the day tho just for the Bpepps(I'm pretty sure I'm starting something hip n new with that street  name...jealous???)

Definitely not my favorite place in town, but it's not terrible, either.  The Baja Fish Tacos I had were very good, though the salsa was too sweet and not at all spicy for my taste.

It's definitely a locals only kind of place.  I didn't get the best service at the bar, probably because the bartenders were clearly catering to the regulars who come in all the time.  I asked to have a TV changed to a Hurricanes game, and the manager had to approve it.  When the regular next to me wanted to see a Dallas Stars game, they changed it no problem...

I also have a problem with a place that charges extra for seasonal beers. $6 for a 16oz pour of a seasonal beer from Asheville, NC is excessive when I know for a fact Highland charges the same for it as they do all of their beers.  It's price gouging at its finest.  At the same time, I was crazy enough to pay it cause the beer is that good.

Oh well.  I might go back, might not.
Awesome food. the Garlic fries were amazing as well as a special philly for the week with fontana cheese on it. Cant wait to come back and try some of their HUGE beer selection!

The food here is not good. Last time I went, I had the veggie fajitas. They were swimming in oil and seasoned like the chef was having a seizure when he made it. The refried beans looked like they had just been scooped out of a can. Pretty sure the sick feeling I had in the pit of my stomach was because of this dish. Other entrees I've had here were not great either. 

Duckworth's redeeming factors are their large selection of beer and convenient location along Park Rd. Also, their bloody marys are right on. 

To summarize, come here for drinks, eat elsewhere.

Ho-hum.

It is a great spot to go to when other places around me are closed or too far away to drive to when I am hungry. This establishment is convenient that they close a lot later.

Venue - your typical bar-sy place. Yet I would say its cleaner and cool. Definitely not dirty, otherwise, I wouldn't come back here again. 

Food - I like their ribs/wings combo you can order. The ribs are good, little on the dry side, but still edible. The wings are alright, but very greasy (aren't wings greasy anyways?). I had an opportunity to order mushroom burger, on other day that I came here. It was decent. *shrugs*

Drinks - they have my favorite wine-Belgian beer, Linderman's Framboise! 

I would be back for an outing at the bar area, with friends.

Great variety, great food!

We came in from out of town, and we really like going to different, local restaurants. My wife had the Pesto Chicken Sandwich, I had the Steak & Egg Philly, the kids had wings, pizza & a cheese burger and my parents had the classic Philly and the Shrimp Tacos. 

Everything was very good, our waiter was friendly & attentive, and we even stuck around for dessert. 
We loved getting to sit outside on the patio in the shade and just enjoy the evening. 

If we lived here, we'd be back! 
If we come through again, we'll make a point of it!

Just tried the new Duckworth's off of Park Road.  New menu provides excellent burgers, scrumptious new "build your own salads" and tasty flatbreads!  Still has the great selection of craft beers and drinks!

Unreal beer selection!  The food is fine - I had the wings which were meaty and hot.  I also got the mozzarella sticks - who can screw those up?  Prices are reasonable and they had Hopslam - YUM - for $6 bucks a bottle Monday night.  Awesome!!  They said they have a good inventory of it so we will definitely be back when we run out!

The atmosphere of this place is pretty relaxed.  Plenty of large screen tvs for watching the games.  The booths are really comfy and looks out on busy Park Road.  

The service was friendly and fine.  This past Monday it seemed like a family place but probably for sports games it fills up.  I will definitely be back if I am in the neighborhood!

Great beer selection, and great specials. $3 drafts on Tuesdays and Thursdays!!

The food is slightly above average bar food. Try out the cheesesteak, it's pretty good.

Absolutely disappointed. Got delivery from postmates. Had multiple missing items and everything I got was absolutely disgraceful or wrong. Got a half BBQ chicken and received one chicken breast got a side Cesar salad and got honey mustard dressing. Well who eats honey mustard on a Cesar salad? I dint ask for that!!! Ordered two cheesecake and only received one. And the one that I got tastes like it's been in the fridge for over a month. Very unprofessional. Will never order from this place again nor recommend it!!! Oh and I have the pics attached for the people that don't believe. Did I mention the salad was half rotted. Y'all trying to kill me?!!!! I'm very angry and don't know if I should go off on duckworths or postmates. Might as well have packed me a bag of dookie. After working a 12 hour long day and you decide to treat your to a lavish dinner, and you get this? It's like I'm on a prank show to see how mad people can make me.

My group of 4 ended up at Duckworth's as a last choice (the restaurant we wanted to go to had a two-hour wait). I reluctantly agreed to "bar-food," but was delighted when I realized what a gem this place is! We sat on the patio and enjoyed people watching the early-Montford crowd.

The menu is big with lots of appealing choices for diners. My boyfriend and I split a cheesesteak (recommended by the people eating with us) and a side salad. He also got some Sweet Heat wings which he said were very tasty -- although he would have liked a smaller option than the 10 wings. The side salad was big and tasty. I expected a nasty, small garden salad (you know what I'm talking about), but this was pretty good! The cheesesteak was delicious; we opted for the "Steak and Egg" and, while we had hoped the egg would be fried on top of the steak when it was actually scrambled in with the meat (?), I definitely didn't mind the extra protein. As a Northerner, I'd happily go back here when I need my grease-fix. The boardwalk fries were nothing to rave about, but we didn't mind since we were so full from the sandwich anyway. 

Thanks, Duckworth's!
Love this place. I go here on Tuesday and Thursdays for their lint night, they have an awesome selection of beer on tap

We just moved to the area and this place by far has been our favorite spot to go for lunch or dinner, so many choices the kids love it and my husband and i go for a beer and appetizer on Saturdays. Prices are very reasonable. The service is outstanding we absolutely love it.

The food is great but the menu selection could be better. Great drink selection & an awesome location on Montfort. It's in walking distance to lots of great bars. The service is great; servers are very attentive. (Downfall; they took off mozzarella sticks off the menu.)

Lots of beer options, lots of food options from , Mexican, Italian, American.  Waitstaff great knowledgeable and friendly

Fajita salad awesome ask for their salsa to add to the meal.  Buffalo Chicken philly mild and could of used more filling in sandwich.

Dessert Strawberry shortcake cheesecake amazing. 

I gave a 4 because of cleanliness and the philly, bathroom corners were pretty nasty occasionally someone needs to scrub them also where kegs were stored needs an occasional vacuum walking by them the floor could use some care

If you love beer this is your place. So many taps I did not even bother counting them all. So many of the beers I never heard of but not hey let you sample as many as you want. The bartenders help steer you to the right beer for you. Now the food. We had some wings which were better than most other plac s we have had wings at lately. We also had a hamburger which was jade out of good beef but it was just a regular burger. Helpful and friendly staff. An overall good place to go from time to time.

Stopped in today to watch the Jets/Pats game.  Asked the hostess if it would be on one of the FIVE tv's at the bar and she said NO even though there was no one sitting at the bar!  Couldn't believe she wouldn't accommodate us? Asked again and she said no, so went directly to the Bartender to see if he would put it on and he was in a fog and didn't seem to know what we were asking him to do.  We told the hostess we were leaving because of the game status (remember no one at the bar) and she had one last chance to solve the problem but she let us walk out...walked down to Braswell's and sat at the bar and asked where the Jets/Pats game would be shown and she said "wherever you would like it". Well done Braswell's well done!!!

I like the new concept they've implemented. I found that the previous menu was too much. Too many options for me to sift through. I like the consolidated menu and the beverages listed on the iPad. The new decor looks great. Taylor was our waitress this past weekend and she was a real gem. Knowledgeable and so friendly. Made sure she checked on us.

Food is certainly not why I would roll in here.  That being said it's a great place to grab a cold one.  They have I think 60 selections of beer and most importantly the staff seems well versed in the types of beer, etc.  That's a plus for an inquisitive guy like me.  

I had the cobb salad and it was just fine.  Topped with grilled chicken and dressed in a vinegarette dressing to finish it off.  

My favorite part (I think I noted this in my review of the other Duckworths) is the $3.00 nightly drafts.  It's not just the crappy beer included in that!  I had a fantastic IMP IPA while I was there.  

This location, while furnished with comfy booths, etc. still isn't the size of the one over in Ballantyne.  It's probably half the size or smaller I think.

Holy cow why haven't I come here more often!!!! 
It's been years since I sat down in this place. Today they killed it with the chicken cheese steak hoagie. As good as Philly or jersey. I was shocked!
Shredded chicken with American cheese on a really good roll with lettuce and tomato (hold the onions) 
I mean sounds pretty simple right? Well people screw it up allllll the time (especially in the south) 
Not here! I'll be back in a few days for another one!  Goodness gracious it was soo yummy. 

The service was good. There are tvs everywhere, they have A LOT of beer on tap, a big menu to accommodate your whole crew(even the picky ones), a patio and its conveniently located right on park road at the corner of Montford. 

I also like that they are open In between lunch and dinner, as often as I'd love to eat at 12, work or life pulls you in other directions so this is good place to come.... I mean today we had lunch at 4 lol and they accommodated and had a nice little crowd in there catching up on Indy and Coca Cola 600 news! Ya know what?
I might just become a regular 
This place is great!

Been reading about duckworths forever. We finally stopped in for lunch. The waiter Darrius was great. He recommended a Philly steak which he said was his favorite. It was great. My wife had a steak salad which she loved. 
The beer list was almost too large. I felt like I was taking the SAT exam flipping through pages trying to find a beer. I settled on a flight which was well priced and the beers were great. 
Tons of TVs if you are into that. Overall, the food and drink were really great! Will definitely go back if we are in the neighborhood.

Went on corporate lunch with a group of 8 people. Fast and enthusiastic server. However, they got my order wrong. Ordered cheddar cheese on burger but they put American cheese. Instead of creating new burger with correct cheese, they took the burger back and melted an additional cheddar cheese slice on top of the American cheese slice with the top of my burger bun now soggy from them potentially zapping the burger in the microwave. So, therefore, burger not impressive. The only thing I liked was the bacon they put on the burger which was quality stuff. I would not order this again.

First visit since remodel. Sat outside, so can't comment on inside, but.... They took pizza  and Asian salad off the menu!!. My two go tos for dinners. Beer is now on a tablet.  List was much easier to use.  May not go quite as often.  Service and food was good, but limited menu now missing favorites.

In town for a visit and what a great discovery!! The beer selection could be the best I've ever seen and blows away any place in NYC i can think of including the Ginergerman, DBA , blind tiger. 
Different atmosphere than any of the NYC places and is more of a local sports bar , but man what a selection of fresh tap beers, bottle beers served by an extremely knowledgeable bartenders. Great wings, good pizza . Thankfully I don't live near this place or I'd be divorced.

I have GOT to update my original review. Went here in a Saturday night and there were tumbleweeds in this joint. Unfortunately, we soon discovered why! The server was slow. The bathroom was gross. The food is decent. I ordered the italian sub. It was aight. Just okay I say. But to their credit I wasnt expecting Thomas Keller level at a sports bar. They had a beer special i ordered that came out in a child's size cup. All petty things aside what really would have made my meal more enjoyable would have been better service. And a better atmosphere. Back in the day you could barely get a seat at the bar. I don't know what happened to this place! Duckworths South Park you had soooo much potential. Please go to rehab and come back to me when your clean.
Food was okay... service not the best...fruit fly in my drink... I prefer the one in huntersville. Everything is much better at that one.

This place is a great place to hang out with friends and catch up. 

We go every Tuesday for $3.50 draft night and we love that we get to try new craft beers for a reasonable price. The garlic fries are the best to munch on with your beer and the friendly staff will make you feel comfortable.

The wait can be a bit much, but if you're there with friends for beer, it's really great.

This place has great food, and great beer. 

Let's get the important stuff out of the way: beer.  Duckworth's has one of the more impressive draft beer selections in Charlotte.  I would say top 3 in Charlotte.  They have a lot of great and random beers.  The hard part is picking WHICH beer you want.  

Food:  I wanted to tell you that the food across the board is great.  However, in writing this and being honest - I have only had 1 thing.  That one thing was the Chicken Philly Supreme, and it's awesome.  Get the Boardwalk fries - They are great!  

I'm a quasi-regular here.  The food and beer are great.  Give it a shot, you won't be disappointed.

The service and food were fine. I enjoyed my Philly Cheesesteak and garlic fries. I also really enjoyed the zucchini fries we had as an appetizer. Everyone else enjoyed their food as well, for the most part. MY one complaint is they seated the five of us at a table that really should have been a four top. There was another table right behind us in the same situation. While the rest of the area was empty, we were placed right on top of one another. They could have easily pulled two tables together and given us more room. Even as the place got busier, there were many tables left empty. AS I mentioned, the service was quite friendly and on top of refills, etc. The food was tasty and hot. This is not something that will keep me from coming back again, but (admittedly, I have a larger than average personal air space) it does factor into my enjoyment overall when I am having trouble banging knees with others, overlapping utensils, and finding a place for all the plates.

What an incredibly poor place to go for a Friday lunch.

We cancelled the 1 Philly Cheesesteak order after an hour's wait with no updates....

Manager's response: "OK"...Sheesh.  

The shame is I've been up to now a big fan of the food and the service....

Sorry guys but a big fail today.

To have Cheesesteaks in the name...they miss having a great cheesesteak by a mile. I would love to find a good cheesesteak in Charlotte but this isnt the place. Plus its way over priced for the product you get.

We ordered the sweet and bold gold wings with two Belgian beers ! The pizza was made to order with green peppers , onions and fresh basil.  All in all the food is really good and they have a wide selection on beers on tap ! We did 6 Jäger shots which were a special that day. Will come back again for sure.
Great service. Awesome place to come and watch some football. Waitress was great and helped me select a beer that I wouldn't have chosen otherwise. One of my favorite spots in Charlotte.

You'll find me here on a weekly basis. 36+ beers on tap that are rotated frequently. There is always something new to try. If a game is on TV, they'll have a TV for you to watch it on.The food is great for pub food. They have daily specials that the chef creates. If you have a chance to try the Blue cheese & spinach stuffed portabella mushroom take it! Definitely try the buffalo blue cheese chips or as I prefer buffalo blue cheese french fries.
Great bar food and the BEST sweet potato fries that I've had in Charlotte. Easy going atmosphere and the kiddos ate for free because it was Wednesday.
Our server was Chrystal and she was amazing very energetic and charismatic! A true gem! The food was delightful and delicious. Keep up the good work and we will for sure be back!!!
Great restaurant! Good food and service...was able to watch all the Sunday football games including my team.
Seated quickly and then sat unattended for over 15 minutes without anyone even taking a drink order.  Can't review the beverages or food, we left.

Delicious Delicious Delicious!!! The fajitas are delivered on a wooden skillet sizzling straight from the grill!!! The chicken was spicy and moist, good enough to be eaten alone. It's a large amount of chicken, much more than the average restaurant.  It comes with 4 tortillas and a moderate amount of fillings (lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, beans, guacamole.) Friendly staff, manager and clean bathrooms!  Thanks Crystal for great service!

Nice looking place tons of TV's there is not a blind place to be found. Excellent beer list with tons of drafts and bottles. I tested them by getting a bottle to see if they brought a glass. All beer should be poured you don't drink wine right from the box!! Not only did I get a glass but they poured it too!  The food menu is very respectable with the normal bar food. Today I got the ribeye and it was delicious. We have been here many times and will continue to come.

Duckworths at Ballantyne was my top favorite restaurant.  Moved down the list to third. Great wings, fajitas, BBQ, and awesome Philly Cheesesteak. This is until they decided to expand.  We go out of our way because the closest restaurant to us is 30 minutes away. The last two visits were terrible. There is a difference between charred and burnt and cooks need to know this.  At the Uptown location our wings literally were burnt and had terrible burnt taste. My husbands fajitas were burnt also.  The onions were totally black and the "charred" chicken taste so burnt it was inedible.  Too expensive of a meal for this.  Waitresses should refuse to deliver food to the table. We don't like to complain or return food but it has really become necessary when our food is being delivered so burnt it is all you taste and miss the great grilled flavor.   Our last visit was the Park Road location and our wings were burnt again. So black and charred all you could taste was burnt flavor.  My husband ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and the burnt taste overpowered the great grill flavor. We again hate to complain but decided to just let our server know because we hate to see our favorite restaurant start falling in the ranks.  Sad, but expansion tends to do that to a good restaurant.  "Tool many cooks in the kitchen spoil a good meal" might just be the phrase for the fast growing chain. We didn't get them to recook anything or expect any compensations, just want Duckworths to stay on top and get chefs to get some training from Ballantyne location. Note: There is a fine line between charred and burnt and too many times you are crossing that line.

Great experience and the food is really good. There has been lots of changes over the past year. The menu is much better (condensed)and the prices are great. It was a very clean restaurant and the  service is great. Manager came up to check on us and the food came out really quick. Get the steak and cheese, you won't regret it! 

Samer

I really WANT to give Duckworth's a higher rating, but they fucked themselves on this one.

The good: 
The fish tacos were "okay." Grilled fish, decent flavor profile. Tortillas, meh. Not very good. But I'm a tortilla snob. If you're going to offer em, make em fresh.
The Philly Cheesesteak was unbelievable. Best cheesesteak I've had since the last time I was in Philly. Awesome.

The bad:
The service fucking sucks. Let me be clear: it doesn't just suck, it FUCKING SUCKS. It was slow, lazy and they got an order completely wrong. 

The meal came out slowly, which was not that horrible, but noticeable. Still, I thought the restaurant deserved a solid four stars. But as the meal was ending, my dining companion ordered potato skins to-go to bring to his wife. As she was pregnant and had an aversion to certain foods, he very clearly and explicitly ordered the potato skins without onions or bacon.

Well, I'll bet you can guess what kind of merry-go-fucking-fuck-coaster came next, right? It took a half an hour after we were done eating (and twenty minutes after we'd paid for the damn things) for the potato skins to come out. And when they did, guess fucking what? Onions and bacon up on that bitch. Needless to say, my friend and I were livid. 

We got the manager and his saving grace (and the only reason why this restaurant gets two stars) is he quickly fixed it. Skins were back out sans onions and bacon and  the amount we paid for them was quickly refunded. Good to know there's one competent person in this restaurant.

I guess maybe some day I can be convinced to go back, but those idiot fucking servers had better tremble if they see my face in that restaurant again. Because if they fuck up, I will come down on that restaurant like the Hammer of Thor.

(With apologies to It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia.)

The server is good but they are out of several beers that I want. Perhaps they could work with the distributers or something and anticipate the need to have a better supply. I will also say the food is good but that is far overshadowed by them running out beer I want.

Cant recommend the buffalo chicken or bacon chicken wraps my wife and I just ate. The buffalo has very little heat and is no where close to the traditional flavor you expect. The Bacon chicken wrap was bland. The banana pepper appetizer was on point though - good stuff.

Been to duckworths a few times for dinner and for drinks with friends. It's a pretty straight forward restaurant bar. Tvs all around. Good selection of beers. Nice food selections. 

One of the best things about duckworths (IMHO) is that it's open late. It's tough to find a casual spot open late in or near South Park. This is one of our go-to spots when it's late. I also like taco Mac during times like this, but some people find it too big and overwhelming with all of the TVs, countless beer options and so on. Duckworths has the feel of a more intimate sports bar. I like it.

I can't type another word without talking about their food. Specifically their wings. I love their wings! Recently a group of five of us went and split 24 wings and fries and just had a lovely time. I've tried other things (ribs, chicken tenders, salads), but now that I've tried their wings, I'm going to keep coming back for them. They do have daily food and drink specials which are also definitely worth considering. 

Service was quick and friendly and the prices aren't bad at all. I'd recommend it!

After discovering Duckworth's in January I proudly say I'm a regular!  Even though I don't live in the neighborhood anymore, this is definitely me & my sweetie's go to place for sports, beer & nibbles!

We've enjoyed getting to know our favorite bartenders (Anthony, Corey, Tara) as well as being known by them by name as well!

They are always friendly, helpful and have great selections for us to try as they change their taps over as they know our tastes!

We love the place, the people, the beers, the food and the atmosphere!  We recommend it to others and look forward to visiting many more times during football season and into infinity & beyond!

I'm baffled by the positive reviews of the food here. I wanted to like this place, on account of the vibe and impressive beer selection, but the food made that truly impossible. We came on a Sunday night and ordered a salad and pulled pork platter. Our appetizers were the fried banana peppers and the caprese salad. The fried banana peppers are just not something you want to eat a whole plate of - after about 5, the spicy, briny flavor and oodles of friedness just get to be overpowering. The caprese salad was drowning in dressing. The entree salad wasn't bad, but not impressive. What really stole the show was the pulled pork entree. The moment it arrived at our table, all we could do was stare. I've never seen pulled pork look wet and gray like that. It's not that hard to make food look edible, so when it looks bad right out of the gate, you know it's probably going to be awful. And awful it was. I've known my boyfriend for over a decade and this is the first time I've ever seen him send a dish back. He apologetically explained to the server that it tasted like it had been microwaved, and the server admitted that this was actually how they prepare it. Microwaving their pulled pork is apparently standard operating procedure in the kitchen. Based on how wet it was, I'm guessing it's microwaved in a plastic bag and dumped onto a plate. I've never heard of a restaurant where microwaving entrees is part of the protocol in the kitchen. The server admitted that some things on the menu had recently changed, and this was one of them. It sounds like management is trying to save on food costs by cutting corners. But this was truly egregious - no restaurateur with any respect for their trade could possibly condone what's going on in the kitchen at Duckworth's.

All I can guess is that things must have been MUCH better once upon a time here, considering the good reviews this place has gotten. Whatever they've changed, they need to change it right back, stat.

(Note: the manager did take off the entree in question from the bill and the staff was generally OK, but even the service/hospitality of Duckworth's didn't really impress)

Clean, classy, casual, spacious and friendly staff helps complete a good experience here but I am distracted by the many wonderful beers to choose from. Not to mention a wonderful selection of liquors. I haven't even got to the food yet, amazing.

Nachos, burgers and beers really hit the spot for me but also try the grilled chicken, you won't be disappointed.
Great "Gastro Pub" type eatery! The staff was friendly and very knowledgeable. The food and beer selection was also ample, even had a few California beers on there for me!

This was my 2nd visit to a Duckworth's (the other was the Ballantyne location).  Unfortunately both visits were disappointing.  The bar service was friendly and fast at both locations but the food service was slow and the food was poorly prepared at both locations. I ordered their house special wings (mamoo's wings?) at Ballantyne. It took approximately 30 minutes to get them and when they came out they were cold and the sauce had separated into 1/2 spices and 1/2 grease. I tried to eat a couple of the wings but ended up pushing the plate away and decided to skip eating and just finish my beer and leave. At the Southpark location I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap. Again it took 20-30 mins to get my food (several people who came in after me got their food before I did) and there were very few people in the restaurant.  So not sure why the food service was slow. The chicken was completely over-cooked (charred thin pieces dry as leather) and they forgot to put the buffalo sauce on.  I won't be going back.

I've been here twice, once to eat and once for drinks.  They always seem to have some pretty decent drink specials.  

When I was there to eat I had the club with sweet potato fries.  The club and fries with the honey mustard sauce were great and the price was very reasonable.  I will definitely be back to try some of their other eats.

Duckworths was surprisingly great! The service was awesome and our food was hot and delicious! 
I enjoyed it! 
I will recommend and visit again. I hear that the pizza is good too!

I have found a new love in my life and its name is Van Diest Früli. It is honestly the nectar of the gods. Lambic's can be a bit tart in my opinion, but this fruit infused (Strawberry) juice beer is incredible and perfectly balanced in flavor. My boyfriend and his friend loved it as well (although I am sure they wouldn't like be admitting that)...and his friend even got a double in a pint glass since singles are served in champagne flutes, and god-forbid a man drink his ale from that! Duckworth's is one of the only places I've seen this beer (let me know if anyone knows of another). They have a great selection of beer ranging from $3 on up.

 Our bartenders were attentive and were able to keep up with the crowds from the game. Speaking of football games, holy tv land. There isn't a bad spot in the restaurant to watch the game. We saw people eating and they appeared to have more than just typical bar-food ( a man was eating a steak next to us). 

I'll be back for my Früli fix!

Hey Duckworth's where's the menu, me and my lady come here for the steak salad but it's not on the menu anymore which sucks. I'm not saying you're gonna lose a customer because we really enjoy the Friday night half priced wine. Philly it's good for the Queen City. Bring back the steak salad.

i wasnt very excited about their move bc i liked the old tucked away spot they had, it was never too crowded in a neighborhood that likes to wear places out (my neighborhood) BUT went there yesterday for the first time since they moved and as usual it was great.  just ordered a normal philly cheese steak (cheese wiz and onions) it was the perfect.  while there i was floored by their draft selection.  as far as the myers park/south charlotte area goes this is my #1 beer joint.  i highly rec this spot, like the new locale and really really impressed by the draft selection.  this place is a must for cheesesteak lovers and especially beer lovers.
This is basically the fox & hound with better food, more TVs and better beer selection/specials. It makes me sad we don't have this place in Tulsa. Great place to watch NFL on Sundays!

Went here to watch the NCAA tournament games tonight.  We ordered the buffalo chicken nachos and they didn't disappoint.  These were the BEST NACHOS IVE EVER HAD.  The chip to topping ratio was perfect. Duckworths is an upscale bar with plenty of beer selections.  There are tvs everywhere so you will not miss a game!  Definitely recommend. 

Came back and had wings and the spring mix salad, both really amazing!
Stopped in for lunch on Wednesday. The chicken bacon wrap was phenomenal along with the service. Big props to Kyle for his great service.

First time eating at any Duckworth's and I was pleasantly surprised. I've heard good things about their food and service and we weren't disappointed in this visit. Having just come from Brawley's nearby, we didn't take advantage of the $3 Thurs draft specials but there seemed to be a pretty good selection. Next time for sure!

We split the half rack ribs and 5 wings platter (comes with 2 sides) and it hit the spot. The wings were fresh, tasty and average size. The ribs were great, nicely cooked and still good the next day. The platter also came with two sides and some texas toast. Overall well worth the $17 for us. Oh and the service was on par! He made sure to come back often but not too often to check on us. I'd come back on another Thursday when I'm thirsty.

One place I always forget exist in Charlotte..Not in a bad way, somewhere I do enjoy going to without burning the place out by going every weekend like I do some places.

This establishment has a fair amount of TV's with a very open beer selection. That is one thing that I love is the beer. The food is really good to, I enjoy getting the pizza and love their apps. Most people I know would label this place as a "BAR" but I look at it different only because they have very good food.

60 beers on tap. Sixty. Six-zero. I'm not even the biggest beer drinker, but hot damn that selection makes me feel like I need one every time I come here.

I will look over the menu and try to force myself to order something else, but I just can''t stray away from the Phillys. They are so ridiculously yummy here. My go to: buffalo chicken Philly... add banana peppers. Sometimes I get it with Cheese Whiz. I know, I know... I'm awful. 

When I do have some self control here, I go with the salmon salad and ask for the fish to be cooked in one of the wing sauces. I like terriyaki-hot. I enjoy going here with a group in hopes that I can steal a wing or piece of pizza from someone. Lay off me, I'm starving.

This location has drink specials every day. Tuesdays and Thursdays all the drafts are $3.50. Gah, is it pumpkin beer season yet?!

One big downfall: the parking situation is awful. That's the problem for this entire Montford area. 

I was bummed to move away from this hood and being just a couple blocks away from here. However, I am super excited about their new location set to open Uptown in the old Fox and Hound. Staff tell me to expect that to open around January.

Hooray beer!

Duckworth's is THE place to go if you are in Myers Park and find yourself with a bit of thirst. They have an impressively large selection on draft (including seasonals and hard-to-find-on-tap beers) and an even more expansive selection in bottles. All styles, flavors, and nationalities are represented.

As others have said, the food is bar food, but decently done for what it is. My go-to are their hot dogs. Toasted buns and franks exploding with juicy goodness. The perfect thing to help wash down your beer.

The staff is friendly and fun, and pretty fast and responsive, given how busy this place is. It's relaxed with no pretenses. It's quiet enough to hold a conversation but not so quiet that you feel dumb for yelling at the idiot ref on TV. If you haven't been yet, you're really missing out.

Fantastic food but service was lacking.     I got the shrimp fontina flatbread and it was great.    Very garlicky but I am a huge garlic fan.     Aside from that the caprese appetizers were also very good and the drink menu is out of this world.      Our server kept forgetting about us but the food made up for it.

My first visit to Duckworth's Grill and Taphouse.... Wow, really good! Ordered the TwistedChicken sandwich for lunch.....Fantastic and great BBQ sauce. Tater tots are best I've ever had as well. waiter, Chris knew his 'stuff' and was prompt and attentive.  Great spot... 
I will return!

The outside setting is very good, in a Plaza.  Great for warm nights.  The inside seating, not so good. We had the Philly cheese steaks (it's in the name!) and I was disappointed.  Not enough taste, and not enough cheese.  Overall, pretty "papery" taste.  In addition, the service was subpar, the beer menu was out of date and the one that I was able to order came out warm and flat.
I'm a fan of duckworths, this location has half priced wine on certain days and are very willing to accommodate parties of all sizes.

OMG. 
I passed by this place many times but tonight was the first time in there. We decided to stop in after a movie at Park Rd Theater. 
I won't spend much thumb - typing time on this. 
The food wasn't horrible, but the place was. It was so f*cking loud with the dozen tvs and everyone yelling to be heard over the other people yelling I thought I would scream (but didn't as I realized no one would notice). 
What a wretched place this is. 
Wretched. Seriously.
I don't remember much about this place except for one of the drink specials they had the night I was there- $5 Patron shots.. Ya I definitely took advantage of that.. 4 stars!

The updates that Duckworth's have made to their menu have not gone unnoticed! I had the blackened salmon salad and it was hands down one of the best salads I have ever had. The flavor was amazing and cooked to perfection.
As far as beer selection goes, It's awesome. Food? it's meh...it's overpriced and not very good. Too bad, I would definitely go more often if their food was worth a sh*t

I really like this restaurant - food and service are always fantastic and the beer list is phenomenal!!! The location is a great place to start a fun night, there are several other bars within walking distance on Montford Street. The area is low-key, fun and a much better atmosphere than Uptown, especially for people in their mid to late 20's. 

I especially love that they have Fruli on tap, I fell in love with the strawberry beer in London a couple years ago and have not been able to find it anywhere else in town.

Great drink selectiom here with so many beers on tap and various specials. We visited Friday night, 5 of us, and our server was quirky but hilarious. He steered us away from certain dishes he didnt think was great without telling us not to get it. Food turned out great. I got the chorizo burger with a side of coleslaw. The burger was great but coleslaw was a bit bland. Everyone else enjoyed their food. The thing though... it was friday night around 730 and it was completely dead in the restaurant, yet somehow our food took about 30 minutes from time or order to being served. Not sure what was going on.

So...we totally came here because I was starving and I needed somewhere that wasn't fast food, but I could get a meal fast.  I turn into Joan Rivers or Patti LaBell if I don't eat.  Seriously.

We see Duckworth's all the time as we drive past it every other day or so.  It's close to our "hood" and it's always busy!  We pulled in, I rolled out and walked in without Hubs...because again, I was starving.  I had planned on ordering  to go order so I could devour it in the privacy of my own home but we ended up staying and we sat at the bar.  The bar tender saw that I was about 2 minutes from passing out and went and hurried my order.  Tadaaaaa burger came out.. FAST! It was just what my stomach ordered!

Place is clean, fun, TONS of tv's for watching your favorite college or NFL or any sport, staff is friendly, service was quick, food was good and I will now like to come back and partake in the great patio that they also have!

Thank you Duckworth's for quickly putting food into my belly! :)

I come here any time I'm able to when I'm in Charlotte. My hotel is usually close to the bigger chain grill and taphouses - you know, the one that conjures images of big-eyed aliens and the one that sounds like a Mexican restaurant with good Mac-n-Cheese. However, while the Saucer is pretty good, this place, with a few less taps, eats their lunch. The craft beer selection is managed very well, offering quality hard-to-find pours. In one sitting, I had Hopslam, Big Bad Baptist, and La Terrible: rarities on draft in my travels. As for their food, I can only comment on their wings. Why? Because I can't bring myself to have anything else. Perfectly cooked, perfectly sauced, and delicious, with rich blue cheese to accompany them, as any respectable wing should expect. Ranch lovers, step off, and get a damn salad. But I digress. If you love wings, even with ranch (you probably ate ketchup on everything as a kid, didn't you?), Duckworth's is a wing artisan. I look forward to my next trip to the CLT.

Hungry for a Cheesesteak......Perfect place.  Service was excellent, atmosphere is perfect and the food can't be beat.  Tried the Blue Cheese Chips as an appetizer......Delicious. 
Without a doubt, they will get my repeat business.

I love beer so I must admit I was happy with the large selection of beers on tap.  Also, the $3.00 draft special for nearly everything on the draft menu didn't hurt either.  The food was great too!  I had the blue cheese chips - a delicious first for me, onion rings, and the classic Philly cheese steak.

The only downfall was the service.  When I got there I was not greeted.  Although I was waiting for a buddy of mine, I was shocked that none of the five staff screwing around at the greeters stand said hello or welcome.  So, after roughly ten minutes, I went to the bar to wait  and got a beer.  I felt like the bar keep was inconvenienced by my presence.  How dare I order a beer!  The saving grace was my server once my friend arrived and we moved to a table.  Good job sir!  Although you were the best of the worst, I actually think you did a great job.  Your colleges need to take notes.

We went to Duckworth's for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. They had a very wide variety of beer and menu items. Portions were large and reasonably priced. Not super crowded either. A good place to go and watch a game.

Anyone who thinks Duckworth's has a good cheesesteak has never had a real one. They're one of the few places in Charlotte that ship their bread in from Amoroso's - the same place Geno's and Pat's get it from in Philly. And somehow their cheesesteaks still suck.  It's the meat.  It's not good.

I've had several other menu items here because I like the beer selection - nothing is better than average.

I'm writing in response to the recent remodel. It looks great, but the chairs were not chosen for comfort, booths were comfortable.

The food: I didn't recognize anything new on the menu, and only noticed quite a bit missing. I have been twice since the reopening with 2 different people, and we were all disappointed with the menu. I'll explain:

Removed from menu:
Pizza
Wraps
Cobb salad
Lunch specials 

The wraps were a great option for people like myself who try to avoid bread. The lunch specials included a drink which was nice because the prices are high. Unless I hear wraps are available I do not plan to go back. My husband and friend felt the same. Bummer because all were regulars. Also, all the staff is new so we no longer feel the welcome back vibe.

I have driven past this spot numerous times and finally decided to stop in, and am glad I did. First, the amount of beers here is beyond impressive. There's definitely a beer for everyone on their list. We stopped in on a Wednesday night, and they had a pizza deal going on so my friend went with that. They also had another special that included a growler, which I might have to check out next time. I went with their chicken pesto sandwich, and I asked for it without the bun, and the presentation when it came out was quite nice in place of the bun (I was too hungry and forgot to take a picture of it). 

Overall the prices were decent, their portions were very filling and their beer list was long. Duckworth's will be on my list to frequent again.
Poor service for our large group. Very slow.  Double booked an area for a large group.  Food was just ok but over priced

We have come to Duckworths regularly over the past 4 -5 years.   Unfortunately,  over the past couple of years, culminating with the reopening of the old Fox and Hound location, it has become less and less local, and more and more corporate, with today's episode really proving the point.  So you understand how money hungry they have become, you should know that they now have a policy that they will not mix salad dressing and salad for you.  It's "Corporate Policy" when they are too busy  not to toss a salad in the kitchen.  That's what we were told.  Take a look at the trend in reviews for their restaurants and you'll get the hint.  Maybe  they are hoping to be the next Hickory Tavern, but this would never happen there.  It looks like the duckworth brand has become associated with over reaching in pursuit of expansion.  Go somewhere else, you work too hard for the money they aspire to underdeliver for.

GREAT beer & liquor selection here!! Over 60 beers on tap, and probably over 200 bottles to choose from. Servers are usually very friendly, but if they're slammed, don't expect fast service. In my opinion the food is worth the wait. I've tried fried pickles at many different restaurants around Charlotte, but theirs are still my favorite. I also love their pizza. I usually get pepperoni and add fresh basil. My mom always gets the fajitas...and I always have to grab some of the chicken. Such great flavors in those fajitas!!

Well I finally made it to the new DGT location since my last review and I must say this space is a big improvement and the addition of a nice and large outdoor patio is also great. 

Atmosphere - Spacious, modern-ish, lively, mostly 20 somethings but kids and young parents are here too. 

Food - I had a boring grilled chicken sandwich w/ sweet potato fries. Boring not in taste but b/c it was just a boring order on my part. Oh, I also tried a special appetizer that they had for the day b/c it sounded interesting. It was a peanut butter & jelly flat bread w/ sliced banana and brie cheese. To bad it tasted awful as it was overcooked. 

Service - Friendly, but I would not say attentive as she did not correct the overcooked appetizer.

Overall - The place is still okay and the new location is a nice improvement.  Just be careful when purchasing your appetizers. 

Note: This new location for Duckworth's is just down the street from the old location but the reviews and photos are still the same.  With that being said, some of the older photos on Yelp are not relevant anymore.

You have to come here! Visiting from FL and I wish there was one back home! Came to watch the playoff game and have some wings. Our server Cory was awesome, very attentive and gave us honest suggestions of the menu. We ordered the hot and garlic Parmesan wings (perfectly cooked and crispy)  the Philly  and blue cheese chips. Everything was prompt, hot, had great presentation and Atmosphere was great and packed! We will be back tomorrow night before heading home to FL. Trust me when I say you would be missing out!
Fun weekend spot. The buffalo blue cheese chips are SO yummy. Everything else we had was relatively good - pizzas, sandwiches, salads. Lots of beer options.

Clearly the first thing I have to say is that the parking leaves much to be desired... But! If you go during the day, it's not nearly as bad... 

Now that we've got that out of the way, this place rocks... I love the beer selection because they've got something for everybody... They have options for fries that are out of this world... The garlic fries were so yummy and the boardwalk ones with the Old Bay and malt vinegar? Omigosssssh. Straight yum.  I've even had a salad that surprised the heck out of me with its goodness... Their Spring Mix with the feta, cranberries and pecans was amazing... And I'm not a huge salad fan...

The service is consistently solid here and they have decent daily specials... Give it a shot! You won't be disappointed... :)

I love duckworths beer specials and food (especially the nachos) but their service recently is terrible! Today I walked in and the hostess was grabbing menus to seat us. All of the sudden she told us she couldn't seat us because the kitchen was backed up but when we looked around there were plenty of open tables? We were confused and asked if we could sit down to have drinks and she wouldn't communicate with us any further, it was very bizarre. We decided to sit down in the bar area to figure out where we were going to go and she would not stop staring at us! The most uncomfortable situation ever for a patron. Definitely spoiled my overall opinion on duckworths, what a shame!

Tried the Foothills Sexual Chocolate Stout. Amazing . Paired it with the duck Worth's taphouse with fries sooo good. Anthony served me at the bar very friendly. Also told me about Duckworth's Hop Man Beer Club where you get rewarded for trying beers what's  not to like

WOooo hoooo!!  Great Burger, plethora of beer choices, and extremely friendly bartenders/staff.  What more are you looking for??  Affordable??  On Tu/Th, every single draft is $2.50.  We walked out of there paying about $30 for two man-sized meals, two quality beers each, and big fat smiles on our faces.  You must try anything with the Jalapeno Bacon.. I am salivating just thinking about it.  You have got to give this place a shot if you are in the area.  Dare I say...... GEM ALERT!!    Enjoy!

(Keep an eye out for updates on the food.  I will be back there soon)

-Ian M.
Tried out the "upgraded" duckworth's and I'm not impressed. Awful service on a slow night. I would hate to see the service when it's actually busy.

It looks like a typical sports bar, but the food surpassed typical sports-bar fare. The menu is big. The menu has a lot of variety. I had a hard time choosing what to get. 

We ordered the nachos with chili to split between the four of us. The portion size is obscene. Also obscene was how much of it we ate. Someone joked that Duckworths must put crack in it because we couldn't stop eating it. Addictively good. 

For my entrée I ordered a new menu item: margherita chicken with balsamic reduction (grilled chicken, fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, caramelized onions, basil, and balsamic). The dough was perfectly crisped and I'm glad I veered from my normal red sauce pizza. 

For dessert, we split a pumpkin cake. If I didn't feel sick from the gluttony, I would've eaten the whole thing. It tasted like the best of a carrot cake and apple spice cake. Cream cheese frosting. 

(I can't believe we ate that much.)

Duckworths has a big selection of craft beer and I was happy to order my new favorite: Hop Drop and Roll. 

We are definitely going back. I hope soon. More nachos, please.

Love the beer selection. Great variety and staff will help you choose what you want. Food is great too, definitely more of a variety than most bars. Service can be off some nights but for the most part it is a great place to go for a beer. Half off drafts on Tuesday, half off wine bottles on Fridays.
Kudus to Duckworths; I had a lousy experience , so much so I left a review and the general manager contacted me. That is nice.

Been thinking about the excellent tap beer selection and fantastic sweet potato fries since my last visit to Charlotte 10 months ago. I was finally able to visit again. The staff is efficient and knowledgable about the many beers on tap. The fresh beef burgers are excellent and filling. The environment is fun, if a little loud. All of this, and reasonable prices too!

I cannot believe I have not made it to Duckworth's before now, but SO happy I gave it a try, and look forward to my next visit.
I arrived shortly after noon on Sunday, craving a Bloody Mary. After being carded, ha ha, I received one of the best drinks I have had in a while. It had a great spice with a hint of heat, which I love, and two olives. Perfect !

Having never been before I asked my waiter for his recommendation out of the sandwiches. He recommended the Chicken Filet sandwich in a wrap. I went with his choice. The wrap arrived, chicken grilled too perfection, and a lot of it, with bacon, shredded lettuce, cheese, mayo and honey mustard.  It hit the spot and although a little messy I would definitely get it again. I chose the tator tots as my side, hot and cooked perfectly, although a little greasy, but every once in while everyone needs a little grease. 
While I enjoyed the games on the multiple TVs I saw some great salads go by, ribs, and smelled the amazing fajitas being served on a sizzling platter. Look forward to checking out more of Duckworth's menu. 
And, one added bonus, I thought the customer service was outstanding. Not only was my waiter attentive and friendly the Manager arrived to make sure everything was okay. And, he continued to visit tables during my entire visit, something you do not see too often these days. Great Job!
Chris was an amazing server. He was attentive and humorous. We loved everything that we ordered. If we ever come back to Charlotte we will be making a stop here!
Just ordered wings with extra vegetables. Got 4 pieces of slimy celery. No carrots. No blue cheese. Good thing the wings are good

Not sure why it took me so long before my 1st visit, considering I have worked on this block of Park Road on-and-off for a long time.  I met up with my chicas after work on St. Patty's Day.  The place is small... but we didn't have to wait.  Thursday is their $2.50 Pint Night, and with some exclusions on the higher priced beer  there are still plenty of choices.  However I am almost beer illiterate, so it was like reading French when I was trying to decide on my beer order.  Ended up with a pilsner (you should be happy I remember that word...), it was still kind of hoppy for my taste.  Sometimes I just want to see the word Bud, or Miller.

I ordered a 1/4 lb. Carolina Burger.  To my surprise, it is only $5.29 for that and it even comes with 1-side.  Sweet potato fries was delicious.  Their regular fries weren't bad either.  Most of the sandwiches/salad are around $8.99.  One of the girls ordered a salad and it was huge.  

Service overall was decent, even after it got busy.  I give this place a solid approval.
The food gets a B- but I give it 5 stars cause I been drunk as hell up there and Uber knows exactly where it is!
Best beer in Charlotte hands down, food is average and nothing to write home about, easy to find for a out of towner, if you like local micro brews come here you won't be disappointed.

I have been to Duckworths 5-6 times and I can say that it has gotten progressively worse each time I've gone back. The food is SUPER average and the only thing that happens consistently here is that the service is horrible. Last nights server decided it was more important to hang out in the bar and flirt with coworkers than it was to come and take our order. Food arrived, I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap. No buffalo sauce to be found and when I asked the server about it his reply was "it's a buffalo chicken wrap for sure but there just isn't much buffalo sauce". So instead of fixing it, he went back to the bar to hang out with coworkers. And if anyone ever tells you that their BBQ is good, they're lying. We orders the BBQ and it came out looking like mushy slop. And it tasted a little suspect. I'm pretty sure that it was frozen and then thawed and served. Completely bush league. The only reason that I have this place even 1 star was because of the beer selection. On a contrast, the location in Ballantyne does a great job! But this place? Stay away

Beer o'clock, we dropped into Duckworth's with some sports on the television and a medium busy crowd of after work folks. We took two seats at the bar and ordered our beers. With the beers, a plate of "ultimate chicken nachos" that took about ten minutes to arrive while we sipped at beer.

You don't want to order this by yourself. In fact, it's probably too much for just two people. A full pound of nachos (we were told they fry them here in the kitchen rather than buy them already cooked) and a pound of grilled chicken with a lot of melted cheese, chopped onions and scoops of sour cream and guacamole. We had the jalapenos on the side. It went down well, though I was bummed there were no refried beans under those chips. Isn't that how nachos are supposed to be done?

Anyway, our bartender was friendly and a nice enough guy even if he is a Jets fan.
Awesome food with a great beer selection. Knowledgeable service coming from all of the servers. I will definitely be returning to this place soon!

Draft beer selection is fantastic! The menu of draft beers is multiple pages. And to add to that they have draft specials every Tuesday and Thursday nights. Almost all draft beers on special - does not include high gravity. 

This location is very popular and gets pretty busy. That being said there is a large bar and tons of booths so you will usually get a table. The parking lot is very tight and you usually have to park somewhere down Montford Ave.  Goes with the territory for those that know Montford, but just something to be aware of if you are not familiar with the area. 

Staff is always very friendly and service has been great. Overall this is a great place to get a beer with a friend or meet up w a group.

This review is easy, 4 stars for the beer and 2 for the food. 

First the food, it kind of sucks, it lacks effort, flavor and originality, and 2 stars is really a gift. 

Second the beer, what they do poorly with food they make up for in their beer selection. They have a diverse, creative selection of micro brews from all across the country. The only reason I didn't give the beer 5 stars, is they don't have a worldwide selection, only 3 non-US beers. 

So go to Duckworth's have a couple beers, then go some place else to eat, then go back and have another beer.

Love the beer and food selection here! Had the Sweet n Bold Gold wings and they were scrumptious. Best part was that they were only 75 cents each. If you are looking for a good place to watch the game, I'd definitely recommend this place...lots of seating with good view of the tv! Can't wait to come back and watch my Panthers win the playoffs!
Really nice Philly sandwich and obviously good selection of draft beer. What made it stand out was the service. Everyone was super-friendly. Definitely recommend.

We have probably driven by Duckworth's a thousand times and never really paid much attention to it.  I think the name sounding like a wealthy cartoon character or some other preconceived notion kept us away....idk, but luckily we made time to get here.

The interior is pretty big, with lots of booths and non-shared tables, which is nice, because I hate being stuffed in like cattle.  All of our servers were great and engaging, and even the managers stopped by a couple times to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.

In general they serve pub/bar food with a lot of variety, kind of like a larger and nicer version of Applebee's menu. We fired some of their Mommoo's wings, which were char grilled and underrated spicy, but I would get them again.  We also got the BBQ Chicken & Jalapeño Bacon Flatbread, which was quite large and delicious as well.  

I think their main selling point is that they have a giant variety of beer.  This doesn't move the needle much for me, but the beers we tried were good, so more power to em.

I do really want to come back here, because their menu is huge, with a lot of variety, so I would love to try some of their other options. (e.g. pizzas, burgers, etc.)

The food is very competent american/bar food, definitely no slouch in that arena, but the reason to go is the dozens and dozens of taps.
