And it isn't just that they have a lot of taps, it is that they have cultivated a diverse selection of hard to find styles from belgians to barleywines, and hard to find breweries from the east coast, to the midwest to the northeast. It really is great to find hometown favorites on tap (That taste so much better not in a bottle).

Tuesday and Thursday as 3.50 (including tax) beer day, very few are excluded from the special.

Good food! Huge portion! The price is not so bad either. We ordered summer salad, grilled salmon, and Philly cheesesteak. All pretty good! Haven't tried their fajita, but smells really good! Will try next time!

Visited here a year ago and the menu included steaks. I'm so happy they cut it back and just made it what it is, a decent beer bar. I had a cheeseburger which is the house burger (they don't seem to give you options unless it is something in the menu)  The burger was delicious. She is ordered a chicken cheesesteak and asked if the owner was from Pennsylvania cause it was that good. We came to find out the rolls are from NJ. Our server was nice and polite and quick to offer beverage ideas. I know they are trying to play to the craft beer crowd and cutting back the menu which is good

If you can get to Duckworth's early enough to get a table, you won't be disappointed. Our server (I think it was Brian), was helpful in selecting delicious beers and brought out samples as needed by our very large (and even louder) group. We only ate appetizers and pizzas, but they came out relatively quickly given how busy the place was and were awfully good. Their fajita nachos are big enough for about 7 people, but sadly don't have as much chicken as some other local places. They're darn good though. The prices seemed pretty reasonable for the portion sizes. The only downfall is that the beer list is a little confusing. Not very well organized, so it's helpful to have a server who knows beer and can lead you in the right direction ( or offer free samples so you can make sure you're getting what you want!)

I deem thee Hickory Tavern.
This place is very similar to Hickory Tavern. Good selection of craft beer on draft, good selection of food, lots of TV's. You go here, for those items, and then depending on the quality of service and the execution of the kitchen, you have a good experience or not so good experience. 

We arrived around 6:30, and were told there was a 30 minute wait for a table. ok, not so bad. Then within 5 minutes, they seated us. We walked by 4 empty tables on the way to our seat. Not sure why the host was so far off on the seating wait time, but things were looking up. The waiter was nice and knowledgeable. I ordered a beer flight (which HT doesn't have). We order potato skins as an appetizer. Then we waited, and waited, and waited. Our waiter came back through twice and asked if we were ready to order our dinner, and we kept telling him, after the appetizer arrives, we'll order our food. On his third visit, I told him, I don't believe the appetizer is actually ever going to arrive, so let's order the food. After about 30 minutes, the appetizer finally arrived, and it was good. Real potatoes, not the frozen kind. The food arrived relatively quickly, but without our side order of fries. We waited, waited, waited. I told the waiter, you forgot the fries. We had finished the entree. we waited. And finally, the fries arrived.

The food here was good. The beer selection excellent. It was crowded. The execution on our order was poor. Not a lot of parking. Its very similar feel and menu to Hickory Tavern, with a 2x better beer selection.

Great bar. Many TVs and are accommodating to what you want to watch. I had the fish sandwich, which was awesome.
Beer selection and recs are amazing. Will be back again.
The food was great, service was fast....I ordered bbq chicken flat bread and my friend order buffalo chicken wrap with garlic fries!!!! All I can say is yess gawd ::-) !!#!###### we'll be back

So I am a fan of everything Duckworths:  beer selection, food, people... everything except the parking situation here.  Except for a couple of compact spaces and few regular spaces out in front, the parking lot here can be somewhat of a deathtrap.  I usually end up parking pretty far away depending on how much I want to risk my life that day, but I just hate having to deal with the overflow from Montford Dr.... regardless... the parking situation isn't changing anytime soon, so I just deal with it.  People PLEASE!  for the love of whatever you believe in, slow down and don't hit pedestrians and other shoppers that have business here - it will not hurt you to wait another 30 seconds to get your latte or whatever it is you are zipping around the parking lot for.  I've had some near misses here.

ANYWAYS... once you survive the gauntlet traffic parking situation, you can rest easy (at least for a little bit)... have a drink to relax and let your blood-pressure recede to normal levels.

This place is usually packed - which is a good sign.  The food is solid - they have daily specials and their servers and staff are friendly and will get you what you are craving.  Pizza, beer, tacos... they have a wide range of food and rather extensive tap list.  If you go to the other Duckworth's in the area, there's an iPad you can see the latest tap list, but this location is old skool and you gotta do it on paper.  You can also check out the website for the list which is pretty upated.  http://duckworths.com/beer-list/

Overall a solid place to grab a beer/dinner after work.  Watch the parking lot though.

I usually avoid this Duckworths because parking is horrible here. They have a small lot that they share with Starbucks and the Relax the back store and the space are super tight so the chance is that you're going to be crammed up against a land yacht or someone who does not know how to park.

In my past few visits here, I've noticed other things that made me lower my rating of this place. The food is very average - either overspiced or just bland, there is no happy medium. And the beer selection, while they have a lot of beers on tap, the variety isn't what it used to be. On my most recent visit they only had 4 local beers on tap. Really? What a shame.

And service has been hit or miss. There used to be a female bartender here who was outstanding but not sure if she is still there. The two guys I had in my recent visit seemed to be more interested in shooting the BS with each other than assisting customers at the bar.

Sorry Duckworth's, I would expect more from your original location, but lately I just feel I get better food/service/beer selection elsewhere.

A nice local bar and grill.  They have a large selection of beer.  The menu is typical fare from burgers and sandwiches to pizza and quesedillas.  They do it all well and at reasonable prices.  I'm not a fan of the bbq chicken pizza(?) that was on special the last time I was there.  I and several people from my office go after work on the first Thursday of every month, so it's worth returning too.  The only drawback is that parking can be hard to find since Montford has become so popular, but that doesn't bother me since I usually walk there from my office and then walk home to my condo.

So at first this place was always marketed as a great place to get a Philly-style cheese steak.  Which I've had, and they are excellent.  What do I normally get here?  Wings.  Their wings (either the Hot or the Hotter Hot which are quite hot) are excellent.  Perfect amount of sauce, heat, and crisp.

Two more important things regarding Duckworth's.

1) Excellent beer list, well rotated, fresh, and with something for every palate.

2) Excellent ownership/management - They do a wonderful job taking care of their guests and are very knowledgeable on everything they serve.

Definitely a place to try for some casual dining and beer tasting.  Also a good place to watch sports, as there are plenty of TVs.

I came in with a large group of 20 and the staff was very accommodating. They have a large selection of draft beer and plenty of TV's to watch the game. I had the buffalo chicken sandwich which was terrible, I barely ate it. The meat tasted like a frozen Tyson patty and I didn't taste any buffalo sauce although you could see some. I will say the garlic fries were tasty. Overall it was an ok experience. I would come back just for the beer selection, not the food.

Yes, there are a plethora of beers on tap. Yes, there is an extensive menu to quench your tastbuds. Yes, there are enough tv's to distract you from those you really don't want to be there with in the first place (lol). 

BUT.... in order to experience all of that, you have to get service. On the first visit, it was a Friday and the place was semi-packed (we went earlier in the evening) but it took us 10 minutes for our waitress to finally acknowledge that we were sitting there (we watched her check on the table beside and behind ours). The food was good enough for us to return and the draft beer were a decent price (low as $5/glass without special). The waitress was nice and informative on the beer selections so I figured we could give this place another try. 

On our second visit (Thursday evening)... we were quickly seated and waited 15 minutes before deciding to leave. I'm not sure who our waitress was supposed to be, but there were two ladies that were assisting the tables surrounding us. One of them walked around with a pitcher to refill waters... she looked at us and saw that we didn't have any cups on our table and instead of stopping (because she had walked past the table a few times by this point) to ask if we had been helped, or if she could take our drink orders... she turned away and continued check the other customers. 

Common courtesy and basic customer service goes a long way... unfortunately I cannot say that I will give this place another try, as Park Rd is starting to expand it's 'bar and grill' options.

Love the moomoo wings, beers, cheesesteaks.   Been here 10x at least.  No honey beers....bummer.  lots of tvs .... 100 drafts...wow. tired of getting carded though...not flattering after u turn 50...more like offensive.
